description.hltext_display: Europe airports fight to clear Christmas backlog
description.content:
LONDON (AFP) European airports fought to clear a backlog of thousands of stranded Christmas travellers on Wednesday as arctic conditions gripped the continent and sparked fresh delays and cancellations.
Weary passengers faced another day stuck in terminals amid fresh snowfalls and continued freezing temperatures which have hit airports in Britain, Germany, France and Ireland.
Britain has offered to send in troops to end the disruption at London Heathrow, while Frankfurt and Dublin airports faced severe disruption.
Eurocontrol, the continent's air traffic supervisory body, said about 3,000 flights had been cancelled across Europe on Tuesday, with similar numbers of cancellations for each of the past four days.
The cold snap chaos also hit Europe's rail network with long queues snaking outside the London terminal for the Eurostar train link between Britain, France and Belgium.
There was a glimmer of hope for angry passengers who have spent four nights sleeping under foil blankets at Heathrow, Europe's busiest airport, as its second runway reopened late Tuesday.
But the huge backlog at one of the busiest times of year meant services will not immediately return to normal, and the airport planned to run about two-thirds of flights Wednesday. "It is good news to see aircraft taking off and landing from two runways," Colin Matthews, chief executive of airport operator BAA told Sky News. "But it's really important that passengers understand that doesn't mean the full schedule is going to be restored instantly." Airport officials were under increasing pressure to resolve the crisis Wednesday after the EU lashed out at the "unacceptable" disruption caused by the heavy snows. "I am extremely concerned about the level of disruption to travel across Europe caused by severe snow. It is unacceptable and should not happen again," European transport commissioner Siim Kallas said.
British Prime Minister David Cameron said he had offered to use the military to help BAA resolve the crisis at Heathrow, but this offer was refused. "The people stuck there are having an incredibly difficult time, especially just a few days from Christmas, and everything must be done to either get them on holiday or get them home safely," Cameron told a press conference.
Anger was meanwhile mounting among passengers queuing in the cold outside the terminal buildings at Heathrow. "I think this hurts the reputation of the whole country. The airport is the first experience you have and this is not a good experience," Gustaf Malmstrom, 23, told AFP as he tried for a fifth day to get a flight to Stockholm. Most of Heathrow's five terminals were only letting in people who were flying on Tuesday morning, mainly on flights to Asia, while others had to queue outside. Workers handed out silver foil blankets and set up two heated tents.
Eurostar said it was running a restricted service and asked all customers booked to travel before Christmas to refund or exchange their tickets free of charge if their journey was not essential.
The queue of passengers stretched for more than a kilometre around the imposing St Pancras station, and Eurostar warned the chaos looked set to continue. "It's too early at the moment to say when we will get back to normal," a spokeswoman told AFP.
In Germany fresh snowfall caused gridlock at the country's main airport Frankfurt with no flights taking off or landing for around three and a half hours in the morning.
Many internal flights were cancelled because of the arctic conditions, prompting German train company Deutsche Bahn to announce additional services on major routes across the country to help stranded travellers.
Dublin airport grounded all flights until 0800 GMT on Wednesday after Ireland was hit by more than 15 centimetres (six inches) of snow.
In France authorities allowed the two main airports in Paris, Charles de Gaulle and Orly, to remain open around the clock to clear the backlog of delayed flights.

description.hltext_display: Christmas has more flavours this season
description.content:
New Delhi, For years, proof of the pudding lay in the plum cake on Christmas, but bakers in Delhi say flavours ranging from cranberry, raisins, peppermint to even alcohol are selling like - you guessed it - hot cakes! This is one time though when many Christian homes swear by the sweet taste of traditional recipes.
"People have become very picky; they are not driven by the crowd any more. Personalisation and customisation of food items have made them vocal about their taste," said Sandeep, an attendant at Wenger's bakery in central Delhi.
"Earlier, plum cakes were the only option for Christmas. But now, different flavours are being tried a lot. The usual plain flavours have become outdated now, a Mix 'N' Match of different flavours is ruling this season," Manoj, an attendant at Maxim's bakery situated in south Delhi, told I.
Kishi Arora, the cakesmith at Foodaholics, reveals the popular flavours.
"Cranberry, berries, caramel, raisins, tutty-frutty, peppermint, cherry amaretto and tia maria are some of the flavours and ingredients which are catching up. Chocolate rules the chart, as it is considered the most preferred base," Kishi told reporters.
"Tia Maria is a coffee liqueur made originally in Jamaica using Jamaican coffee beans," she said.
The bakers claim moist cakes are the most preferred cakes this season.
Kishi also revealed that alcohol is used widely in the preparation for Christmas confectionery.
"Rum, wine, whisky, tequila and vodka are a few of the alcohols which are used. Alcohol not only adds flavour but, more importantly, acts as a preservative. This means Christmas cakes made with the right amount of alcohol such as brandy, whisky or rum, last for months.
"Alcohol is added at two stages. One is before the baking and the other is soaked while baking, where the food item is soaked in alcohol," Kishi said.
And what is the right proportion in which it should be used?
"It totally depends on the customers' requirement. At times, they ask for quite a boozy cake; so we add two ounces of alcohol. Around 50-100 gm is common in the preparation of cakes," she said.
And what are the other food items popular this season?
"It's not just cakes, but a wide variety of food items are also sold, like cookies, puddings, fudges, cup cakes and brownies. The bread varieties include sweet bread, ginger, candy canes and marshmallow, among others," said Sandeep.
Catholic families traditionally prepare cakes at home and give a lot of importance to cleanliness and initial preparations.
"Like other communities celebrate and exchange gifts, Christmas is a very big festival for us. We try to make the most of it and gift the traditional goodies - a tradition being carried forward in our family for years," said Mary Pinto, a resident of south Delhi.
Explaining the cake preparations, Pinto said: "The ingredients (raisin, cashew nuts, cherries) need to be soaked in rum at least 15 days before starting the actual preparations. A powder of ginger, clove and cinnamon is prepared with a small proportion of vanilla essence and rum."
Pinto said sugar is not used in its usual form in these cakes.
"Burnt sugar is used. We pour the quantity of sugar that is needed into the vessel and let it melt and burn. This sugar is then used in the cakes," said Pinto.
As a word of advice, bakers say the final product should be stored in air-tight tins and wrapped in foil. They can last for months if kept in the refrigerator.
Recipe 1: Chocolate Truffles
Makes: 25 truffles
Contains: 0.06 units of alcohol per truffle
Preparation time: 30 minutes
Ingredients
100 ml Baileys Hazelnut Flavour
150 g unsalted butter
270 g 66 percent dark chocolate
150 ml double cream
For the dip:
250 g of dark chocolate (min 66 percent cocoa)
250 g cocoa powder
Preparation: Break the chocolate into small lumps. Fill a saucepan with water, place a heatproof bowl inside (large enough so that it rests on the rim of the pan) and bring it to a sim.
Put the chocolate and butter into the heatproof bowl and melt them slowly. Do not stir, as this can cause lumps. When the chocolate and butter melt fully, take the saucepan off the heat and carefully remove the bowl. Whisk in the double cream and Baileys Hazelnut. Leave to set in the fridge for 2 hours.
Using a melon-baller, start scooping out the truffles - they should form the shape of a ball. Place truffles on a plate and leave to cool down in the fridge for half an hour.
When you're ready to serve, melt a further 250 g of (66 percent) chocolate in the same way as before, dip each truffle into the melted chocolate and then roll in cocoa powder.
-*-
Recipe 2: Fudge
Ingredients
400 gm sweetened condensed milk (1 tin Nestle Milkmaid)
1/4 cup sugar
150 gm mixture of cashew nuts/raisins/almonds
1/2 cup cocoa
50 gm unsalted butter
Preparation: Pour Milkmaid into a thick bottomed pan. Add butter, sugar, cocoa and nuts. Swirl gently on medium heat till the mixture leaves the sides of the pan. Pour evenly into a buttered dish and allow cooling and setting. Cut into desired shape with a cutter and toss in icing sugar.. enjoy!!
Happy eating and Merry Christmas!

description.hltext_display: Indian forts relive glorious past in documentary (Feature)
Lebendiger Kalender heute in der Bcherei
description.content: Hambergen (tel). Das 22. Trchen des "lebendigen Adventskalenders" ffnet sich am heutigen Mittwoch an der Samtgemeindebcherei Hambergen. Wie die Leiterin der Bcherei, Kornelia Gtsche, mitteilt, nimmt die Bibliothek in diesem Winter zum ersten Mal an der Aktion der Kirchengemeinde Hambergen teil. Um 18.30 Uhr freuen sich Kornelia Gtsche und ihre Mitarbeiterinnen ber mglichst viele Adventskalender-Gste. Es wird nicht das letzte Mal in diesem Jahr sein, dass die Bcherei ihre Tren ffnet. In den Schulferien wird die Bibliothek am Mittwoch, 29. Dezember, von 9 bis 11.30 Uhr und von 15.30 bis 19 Uhr geffnet haben. Am 23. und am 30. Dezember (donnerstags) bleibt sie hingegen geschlossen. Ab Mittwoch, 5. Januar, gelten wieder die regulren ffnungszeiten.

description.hltext_display: Diego declina; PAN sin candidato fuerte
description.content:
Diego Fernndez de Cevallos. Foto: El Sol de Mxico
Organizacin Editorial Mexicana
Fernando Aguilar / El Sol de Mxico
Ciudad de Mxico.- El diputado federal del PRI Sami David David, seal que con la negativa de Diego Fernndez de Cevallos de convertirse en el candidato del PAN a la Presidencia de la Repblica, Accin Nacional no tiene un candidato fuerte para el 2012.
En entrevista, el legislador chiapaneco declar que esta decisin del excandidato presidencial panista termina con las esperanzas de la derecha para competir con un abanderado de gran trayectoria para contender en los prximos comicios presidenciales, por lo que asegur que el Partido Revolucionario Institucional (PRI) sigue firme en su retorno a la residencia oficial de Los Pinos.
De acuerdo con las declaraciones emitidas a los medios de comunicacin a 24 horas de haber sido liberado de un largo secuestro de ms de siete meses, el tambin exsenador de la Repblica, se descart como candidato del Partido Accin Nacional, al sealar que l slo trabajar para el aspirante a la Primera Magistratura del pas que designe su instituto poltico.
Sami David David se apoy en esas declaraciones para comentar que hasta el momento no se vislumbra a ninguna figura panista que pueda hacerle sombra no slo a Enrique Pea Nieto, quien encabeza las preferencias nacionales, sino a los otros aspirantes del tricolor mencionados tanto por simpatizantes como militantes del PRI. (Beatriz Paredes, Manlio Fabio Beltrones).
"El partido cuenta con hombres y cuadros reconocidos tanto al interior como al exterior del instituto poltico, quienes garantizan desde este momento una victoria en los comicios del prximo ao y sobre todo del 2012, a diferencia de otros partidos que tienen que hacer alianzas para designar a candidatos externos que en su mayora fueron pristas, para tratar de competir con los abanderados pristas", asever el diputado Sami David David.
Por tal motivo, destac, hoy por hoy el revolucionario institucional es y seguir siendo la primera fuerza prista en el pas, como lo han demostrado los triunfos electorales recientes, al igual que la preferencia ciudadana que da a da se inclina ms por nuestros candidatos al considerarlos los ms preparados en todos los aspectos para sacar a Mxico del estancamiento econmico, poltico y social en el que lo han sumergido los 10 aos de Gobierno panista.
Al hacer un balance de la labor polticoelectoral en este ao que est a punto de concluir el diputado chiapaneco reconoci que si bien perdieron tres estados en los pasados comicios locales, la presencia territorial del partido se fortaleci lejos de debilitarse como auguraban algunos detractores de la oposicin, quienes tuvieron que recurrir a candidatos externos para alcanzar el triunfo en las urnas, que no hubieran podido obtener de manera individual ante los abanderados tricolores.
Asimismo coment, que los errores cometidos en la ltima dcada por las dos administraciones panistas, en materia econmica y de seguridad, principalmente, han inclinado las balanzas de las preferencias ciudadanas a favor del PRI, lo cual se pone de manifiesto con los resultados de las ltimas encuestas nacionales que dan como favorito al PRI como partido y al gobernador mexiquense, Enrique Pea Nieto como candidato para ganar las elecciones presidenciales del 2012.
"Hay un nuevo sentido de responsabilidad del PRI hacia el futuro. Tenemos un proyecto poltico que ve al futuro y no se basa en el poder por el poder, sino en la fuerza de los ciudadanos; en eso consiste nuestro compromiso", finaliz.

description.hltext_display: YBM,
Siegerballon flog 450 Kilometer
description.content:
Vollersode. Zum Erntefest in Wallhfen hatte das Erntefestkomitee ein Luftballonweitflug-Wettbewerb ausgerichtet. Bereits zum 34. Mal schickten Kinder aus Wallhfen und Umgebung 240 bunte Luftballons auf eine mglichst weite Reise. Es waren immerhin 56 Ballons mehr als im Jahr zuvor. Darauf wies der Komitee-Vorsitzende Jrgen Renken bei der Siegerehrung der Kinder mit ihren Eltern hin. Sechs Kinder hatte das Komitee eingeladen, ihre Preise abzuholen. Den Mitgliedern des Erntefestkomitees ist es ein besonderes Anliegen, den kleinen Gsten mit der berreichung der Preise eine Vorfreude auf Weihnachten zu bereiten. Jrgen Renken moderierte die Preisverteilung und sein Stellvertreter, Marco Schulz, berreichte die in Weihnachtspapier eingepackten Preise. Natrlich gab es auch einen Schoko-Weihnachtsmann dazu. Wenn die Kinder auch besonders gespannt auf ihre Geschenke waren, blieben sie doch eingepackt. Zu naschen gab es dafr Lebkuchen und Gebck.
Wie Renken erklrte, kamen in diesem Jahr 21 von den an den Ballons befestigten Antwortkarten zurck. Er erinnerte daran, dass in frheren Jahren schon mal Ballons bis Moskau, Prag und Malm geflogen waren. Dieses Jahr hielt es den Siegerballon 450 Kilometer bis auf einem Feld bei Sokolow (Tschechien) in der Luft. Es war der Ballon von der einjhrigen Leni Achilles. Bisher bekam der Gewinner immer eine Uhr. Aber Leni bekam das bungsspiel "Sprechende Farm". Den zweiten Platz belegte Sieglinde Gellrich. Ihrem Ballon ging im Ostseebad Prerow (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) nach 275 Kilometern die Puste aus. Sie hatte allerdings als Komiteefrau auer Konkurrenz mitgemacht. So folgte auf Platz Zwei der zweijhrige Kadir Sahala. Sein Ballon legte einen Luftweg von 240 Kilometern bis Nordhausen (Thringen) zurck. Er bekam ein Lego-Duplo Auto mit Tankstelle. Dritter wurde der zehnjhrige Leon Thiel. 175 Kilometer legte sein Ballon zurck. Leon konnte sich ber einen Lego-Technik (Kompaktbagger)
freuen. Auf Platz vier kam der sechsjhrige Chantal Zwick (162 Kilometer). Fnfte wurde Larissa Tifuh (111 Kilometer). Nur sieben Kilometer flog der Ballon von Nadine Filz. Sie bekam den diesjhrigen Trostpreis.

description.hltext_display: KDI
Larry King verabschiedet sich nach 25 Jahren
description.content:
Am Ende der Show verabschiedete sich Larry King ohne grosse Aufregung.
New York/Los Angeles - Die wohl berhmteste Talkshow der Fernsehgeschichte ist zu Ende. Nach 25 Jahren, jeden Tag, immer am selben Sendeplatz, ist die letzte Ausgabe von Larry King Live bei CNN ber den Sender gegangen.
2 Meldungen im Zusammenhang
Artikel als E-Mail senden
Artikel drucken
Als Bookmark speichern
Mehr Optionen
Viel Prominenz verabschiedete sich bei King, darunter gleich zwei US-Prsidenten. Du bist ein Gigant der Fernsehgeschichte, sagte Amtsinhaber Barack Obama per Videoschaltung. Von Kermit, dem Frosch, bis zu amerikanischen Prsidenten - alle waren sie bei Dir und Du hast uns die Augen geffnet.
Obamas Vorvorgnger, Bill Clinton, sagte, dass King und ihm wohl die Arbeit gut tue: Ich weiss nicht, ob sie uns jung hlt. Aber zumindest hlt sie vom Grab fern.
Schwarzenegger bedankte sich bei King
Kaliforniens Noch-Gouverneur Arnold Schwarzenegger bedankte sich, dass King aus Los Angeles gesendete hatte. Er erklrte Kings letzten Tag auf Sendung zum offiziellen Larry-King-Tag in dem Staat. Immobilienlwe Donald Trump nannte King eine Fernsehlegende und einen grossartigen Freund.
Am Ende der Show, wie immer eine Stunde lang, verabschiedete sich der 77-Jhrige nach 53 Jahren und mehr als 40'000 Interviews ohne grosse Aufregung. Mit seinen Gsten hob er noch ein Glas Wein.
Zuletzt sass er allein im Studio und bedankte sich bei seinen Mitarbeitern und den Zuschauern mit einem Auf bald!. Und ganz zum Schluss glimmerte nur noch sein berhmtes Mikrofon im dunklen Studio.

description.hltext_display: Watch for AMR to Potentially Pullback after Gaining 1.90% Yesterday (AMR)
description.content:
AMR (NYSE:AMR) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $7.95 to a high of $8.11. Yesterday, the shares gained 1.90%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $7.94 on volume of 7.9 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of AMR are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $7.86 and above their 200-day MA of $7.54. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of AMR in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on October 20, 2010 at $7.04. The stock has risen 12.4% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $7.94 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Major Airlines industry.
Keywords: trading range stock news

description.hltext_display: Star Tribune, Minneapolis, Eric Wieffering column [Star Tribune, Minneapolis]
Acusan diputados al Gobierno de incapaz para derrotar la violencia
description.content:
Sesin de la Comisin Permanente de la Cmara de Diputados. Foto: Antonio Zamora / El Sol de Mxico
Organizacin Editorial Mexicana
Gabriel Xantomila / El Sol de Mxico
Ciudad de Mxico.- En la Comisin Permanente del Congreso de la Unin, la oposicin encabezada por el PRI, PRD y PT, acusaron al Gobierno federal de incapaz para derrotar la escalada de violencia y desterrar la corrupcin e impunidad. "El Gobierno federal no quiere reconocer que ha tomado decisiones equivocadas'', dijo desde la tribuna el prista Arturo Zamora Jimnez, al exigir tambin despejar dudas y transparentar la liberacin del panista Diego Fernndez de Cevallos.
Las autoridades han mostrado de manera permanente la incapacidad que padecen para derrotar la violencia en Mxico. Nosotros como Poder Legislativo hemos obsequiado al Poder Ejecutivo todas las reformas, los instrumentos legales y los recursos econmicos, para revertir el fenmeno de la violencia y la impunidad; sin embargo, el Gobierno federal no quiere reconocer que en sus entraas campea la corrupcin, no quiere reconocer que asume malas decisiones, equivocadas, que han deteriorado mucho la vida de los mexicanos.
El lder de los diputados pristas, Francisco Rojas Gutirrez, exigi que la autoridad aclare si el secuestro de Diego Fernndez de Cevallos fue poltico o un asunto meramente criminal. Advirti que sera doblemente grave que la poltica se comience a mezclar con el clima de inseguridad.
"Tenemos que estar conscientes de que pueden empezar a mezclarse el clima de inseguridad y la criminalidad con la poltica, y eso me parece que sera doblemente grave", alert el legislador.
En su oportunidad, Arturo Zamora Jimnez calific de lamentable que en nuestro pas, cualquier ciudadano, cualquiera que sea su condicin econmica o social, padezca este tipo de situaciones que lastiman no solamente a la vctima, sino tambin a sus familiares y a la sociedad en general.
Reiter que han sido creadas y generado normas para perseguirlo; sin embargo, "nos damos cuenta que el Gobierno federal ha hecho poco o realmente nada, para combatir eficazmente este delito''.
"El 'plagio' de Fernndez de Cevallos es una muestra clara y evidente de que el Estado de Derecho ha sido rebasado, es una muestra clara y patente que no existe, ni siquiera en la familia de Fernndez de Cevallos, confianza en el Gobierno federal, porque fueron los mismos familiares quienes pidieron que no intervinieran, precisamente por esa situacin de la carencia de confianza'', explic el prista.
Por su parte, el petista Alfonso Primitivo Ros Vzquez, coincidi que el Poder Legislativo ha dotado al Ejecutivo de todos los instrumentos jurdicos y legales para combatir al crimen organizado, pero no hay resultados.
Adems, reprob el trato privilegiado que Felipe Caldern ha mostrado con Diego Fernndez de Cevallos, "pues no lo ha hecho con los miles de ciudadanos, hombres, mujeres, nios y adultos mayores que han sufrido estos crmenes", dijo.
Record que "Diego Fernndez de Cevallos ha estado desde hace mucho tiempo en el 'ojo del huracn', ha sido cuestionado por utilizar sus relaciones polticas para beneficio personal y amasar grandes fortunas, que como abogado puede tener".
En su momento, el senador panista Alejandro Zapata Perogordo, reconoci el esfuerzo y cooperacin de las autoridades para combatir al crimen organizado, en especial el delito de secuestro; sin embargo, dijo que no es suficiente porque la sociedad se encuentra atemorizada, por lo que exhort a las autoridades para que "en este pas ya no permee ni la complicidad, ni la colusin, ni la corrupcin y podamos entrar al imperio de la ley, mediante la sancin y la convivencia tranquila y armnica entre todos".
Al fijar el posicionamiento del PRD, el senador Ren Arce Islas indic que tras la liberacin de Diego Fernndez de Cevallos, las instituciones nuevamente deben discutir el tema, pues se tiene que contar con sistemas de inteligencia para combatir el delito, ya que a pesar de que se continen aumentando las penas, el flagelo seguir latente de no discutir qu hacer con el secuestro.

description.hltext_display: Ein Frauenleben in New York
description.content:
Lilienthal. New York war das Sehnsuchtsziel von Susanne Schade-Schmcker. "Es sollte nicht sein", sagt sie. "Leise weinend legte ich meinen Reisewunsch in die Schublade zu meinem Pass." Gelassen hat Schade-Schmcker von der Stadt nicht. In der Buchhandlung entdeckte sie "New York", ein Buch der amerikanischen Autorin Lily Brett und das war der Beginn einer wunderbaren Freundschaft." In der Lilienthaler Bibliothek, der Schade-Schmcker seit 25 Jahren treu ist, fand sie weitere Bcher der Autorin und erfuhr mehr vom Lebensgefhl in ihrer Sehnsuchtsstadt. Mal heiter, mal nachdenklich schildert Brett alltgliche Situationen und spiegelt darin "gekonnt die groen Themen des Lebens wider". Bretts Texte sprechen vordergrndig Frauen an, so Schade-Schmcker. Sie empfiehlt als Weihnachtslektre "Zu sehen" - eine Essaysammlung mit Kapiteln wie "Mein Krper", "Sex", "Meine Tochter", "Tod", "Liebe", "Altern" und "Schreiben". Letzteres ist Schade-Schmckers Lieblingskapitel, weil sie selber schreibt. Sie fhle sich von der Autorin verstanden, bewundere Bretts Wahrhaftigkeit und Offenheit, ihren Sinn fr Humor, "der sie auch in den ernsten Momenten des Lebens nicht verlsst".
Brett wurde 1946 in Deutschland geboren, als Kind zweier jdischer Holocaust-berlebender. Die Eltern heirateten im Ghetto von Lodz, wurden im KZ Auschwitz getrennt und fanden sich sechs Monate spter wieder. Auschwitz zieht sich durch Bretts literarische Arbeit, die aus Schade-Schmckers Sicht rein autobiografisch bleibt - "aber so unterhaltsam, dass es mir nicht langweilig wird".
Lily Brett: "Zu sehen", Suhrkamp Verlag, ISBN 3-518-39648-X

Schauspielerin Olivia Wilde ist fest davon berzeugt, dass ihre Ehe nur deshalb so lange hlt, weil sie und ihr Gatte einst durchbrannten.

Deswegen denkst du nicht: 'Wir mssen perfekt sein', sondern: 'Hey, ist das nicht ziemlich optimistisch? Wenn es hlt, haben wir Glck.'
Die sexy Brnette und ihr Ehemann Tao Ruspoli, Sohn eines italienischen Prinzen, kannten sich gerade mal sechs Monate, bevor sie Ja zueinander sagten. Heute, fast acht Jahre nach dem mutigen Schritt, lieben sie sich wie eh und je. Eine der besten Eigenschaften ihres Liebsten ist laut der Aktrice, dass er nie eiferschtig wird, wenn sie vor laufender Kamera etwas mit einem anderen Mann haben muss.Ich glaube, er mag das, lachte Olivia Wilde, es turnt ihn an, dass ich diese Dinge tun darf.

description.hltext_display: MTS Turkmen subscribers switched off from telecom services
description.content:
Turkmenistan, Ashgabat, Dec.22 / Trend H. Hasanov
More than two million subscribers of the Russian mobile operator MTS are completely switched off from telecommunications services and Internet in Turkmenistan.
On Tuesday, the company informed that from Dec. 21 "provision of telecommunications services and Internet may be suspended for about one month". A reference was filed to obtain a notification from the Turkmen Ministry of Communications on suspending the telecom company's license from Dec. 21 without explanation.
"MTS Turkmenistan is making all efforts to solve this problem rapidly and expresses its gratitude for the understanding of the situation," the company said in a statement.

description.hltext_display: Bond issue sought for Riverwalk project
description.author: info@tradingmarkets.com
description.content:
Downtown development leaders have offered up a proposal to pay for Riverwalk improvements as they tinker with the final design of the city's enhanced waterfront district.
Downtown Development Authority Executive Director Mike Kennedy asked DDA board members Tuesday to support the issuance of $5 million in bonds to cover the majority of the $6.2 million project. The rest of the money would come from state and federal grants.
"This is a project that we've been setting aside dollars for over the past couple of years," Kennedy said. "We're in a good position to be able to service the debt if we were to issue a bond."
Plans for the scenic walkway, which runs along the Manatee River from the Green Bridge past Manatee Memorial Hospital, would make downtown more accessible for pedestrians and stimulate the economy by attracting residents, businesses and tourists.
Kennedy said key components of the final design likely will be a lighted walkway under the Green Bridge, a family zone featuring a children's water feature at Rossi Park, and a playground and possibly a skate park and sand volleyball courts near the DeSoto Bridge.
City council must approve the bond issuance after the DDA signs off on the Riverwalk design.
Kennedy hopes to present final designs at a DDA workshop Jan. 11 and unveil them to the public sometime in mid-January.
The DDA could approve the project and bond proposal at its regular meeting Jan. 25, paving the way for the city council to consider issuing the bonds in February.
Construction could begin in late spring, with completion tentatively planned for early 2012, Kennedy said.
The DDA board generally backed the bond proposal, but board member Cork Miller said he wants to make sure debt service won't hamper the authority's efforts in other parts of the city.
"I want to pay it back and still do what we do," he said.
Said Kennedy, "I don't share that concern. ... Even if we're to invest in this Riverwalk public space, we'll still have the flexibility to meet other opportunities that present themselves."
In a Dec. 16 memo, Kennedy presented the DDA board members with budget projections through 2017 for the Bradenton Community Redevelopment Area, which includes Riverwalk.
A 30-year interlocal agreement between the city and county that resulted in the construction of the county's downtown administration building expires in 2017. After the agreement expires, the DDA will begin receiving more than $1 million in county tax increment funding, which it can use to increase its debt payment.
Under the budget projections, the DDA would pay $279,000 in interest-only debt service on the bonds each year through 2016. In 2007, the DDA would begin paying principal and interest for a total of $643,705.
Also Tuesday, Kennedy told the board that Dale Weidemiller will remain as a volunteer project manager on the Riverwalk project. His consulting contract was terminated Nov. 30.
Weidemiller's $80,000 contract to oversee Riverwalk and Artisan Avenue projects was scheduled to run through February, but both parties agreed to end it early because of the slow progress of Artisan Avenue, Kennedy said. The move saved the DDA about $16,000.
The Artisan Avenue project aims to provide a walkable area along 11th Street West to connect the downtown waterfront to Village of the Arts.
For full details on (ZZHKU) ZZHKU. (ZZHKU) has Short Term PowerRatings at TradingMarkets. Details on (ZZHKU) Short Term PowerRatings is available at This Link.

description.hltext_display: Najib: 1M'sia was not copied but my own creation
description.content:
Kuala Lumpur: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak said Tuesday he felt slighted by the allegation that the 1Malaysia concept had been plagiarised from another country.
Describing the allegation as "a big lie", he said the 1Malaysia concept which was introduced after he helmed the country's administration was his own creation.
"The 1Malaysia concept was not copied from another country.
It is my own creation. Other countries may have a one this and a one that but nowhere in this world is there a 1Malaysia: People First, Performance Now," he said when opening the Cuepacs triennial convention, here.
In a stern voice, Najib said the Government moved forward on the basis of reality and not any dream.
"It is very easy for us to make a political promise, but will that something based on the most populist approach be beneficial to us or otherwise?" he asked. Najib said a responsible government focused on developing a country should uphold and implement responsible policies.
"A responsible government needs responsible policies...not promises which are not founded on reality," he said.
Najib has come under criticism by several quarters, particularly Opposition Leader Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim who had alleged that the Government, through global communication consulting firm Apco Worldwide, had plagiarised the 1Malaysia concept from the OneIsrael campaign which the same company had allegedly created for the Zionist regime in 1999.
The Parliamentary Rights and Privileges Committee found Anwar's allegation to be without basis and recommended to the Dewan Rakyat for him to be suspended from the house for six months.
Last Thursday, before it adjourned sine die, the Dewan Rakyat suspended Anwar for six months. Three other opposition MPs, Karpal Singh (DAP-Bukit Gelugor), R. Sivarasa (PKR-Subang) and Azmin Ali (PKR-Gombak), were also suspended for six months for contempt because of making public information privy to the rights and privileges committee.
On the question of bonus for civil servants, Najib, who is also Finance Minister, said it would be considered if the financial position of the Government was strong.
The Prime Minister said the Government understood what Cuepacs wanted but the Government had to be realistic in its spending.
"We will do the best (for the people) but within the capability (of the government). I would be most happy if I could pay bonus because I would be able to see the smiles on the faces of the 1.3 million civil servants.
But we have to be realistic. Our expenditure cannot exceed our income," he said.
Najib said the Government did not want to be forced into borrowing from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) just to pay the salaries of civil servants.
"If we do that, in no time we will become a country administered by the IMF. With the IMF administering the country, our independence will become meaningless," he said.
In his address to the 1,171 delegates, Najib reminded civil servants serving on the frontlines to understand the Government Transformation Programme (GTP) as they reflected the Government's image.
"If these frontliners do not subject themselves to a shift in the mindset, then there will be disappointment among the people.
"They (the people) will be disappointed with the Government because the policies announced at the highest level for implementation would not have reached the frontliners in the Government," he said, advising Cuepacs to ensure the mindset shift.
The Prime Minister also said civil servants must undergo a mindset change to openly accept and facilitate the entry of foreigners in government service.
He said civil servants should not look upon foreigners with suspicion because, more importantly, it was necessary to obtain foreign expertise for the country to remain competitive.-Bernama

description.hltext_display: "Amigos" singen von der Sehnsucht
description.content: Osterholz-Scharmbeck (cva). Das Schlagerduo "Die Amigos", wird am Freitag, 28. Januar, in der Stadthalle Osterholz-Scharmbeck zu Gast sein. Die Snger werden dort ab 19.30 Uhr ihr neues Tourneeprogramm mit dem Titel "Sehnsucht, die wie Feuer brennt" vorstellen. Die Gste soll unter anderem ein ansprechendes Bhnenprogramm und eine neue Lightshow erwarten, wie es heit. Freunde der Schlagermusik schtzen die Brder Bernd und Karl-Heinz Ulrich unter anderem fr ihre deutschen Texte. Seit 40 Jahren steht das Duo auf der Bhne. Beide spielen seit ihrer Kindheit Instrumente: Bernd erlernte das Schlagzeugspielen und Karl-Heinz Ulrich spielt Gitarre und Keyboard. Ihre Fans knnen sich am Freitag, 28. Januar, ab 19.30 Uhr von ihrem Knnen erneut berzeugen. Eintrittskarten fr das Konzert der "Amigos" sind ab 33,95 Euro unter anderem beim OSTERHOLZER KREISBLATT an der Brdestrae, bei Go!Reisen an der Bahnhofstrae, beim Stadtmarketing am Marktplatz und in den Vorverkaufsstellen von Nordwest-Ticket erhltlich.

description.hltext_display: Tsunami warning after Japan quake
description.content:
TOKYO - An earthquake with a magnitude of 7.4 jolted islands in the Pacific southeast of mainland Japan on Wednesday and a tsunami warning was issued, the Japan Meteorological Agency said.
There were no immediate reports of damage, public broadcaster NHK said, adding the tsunami warning was for waves of up to one metre (3 feet) high for the Ogasawara islands, about 1,000 km (620 miles) south of Tokyo. Small waves had already hit one of the islands, NHK reported.
The focus of the tremor was about 130 km (80 miles) northeast of Chichijima island and about 10 km under the sea, the agency said.
Japan lies in one of the world's most seismically active areas. It accounts for about 20 percent of the world's earthquakes of magnitude six or greater.
(Reporting by Yoko Kubota; editing by Andrew Dobbie)

event_or_fact.property: jolted islands in the Pacific southeast of mainland
about 130 km (80 miles) northeast of Chichijima island

description.hltext_display: Deadly sea snake found at Ke'ehi Lagoon
description.author: Marisa Yamane
description.content:
Courtesy: Carroll Cox Usually when people get excited at Ke'ehi Lagoon, it has to do with an outrigger canoe race.
But today, folks got excited over something much different.
A deadly sea snake was discovered in the water.
The snake was found around lunchtime.
Luckily no one got hurt or killed.
Next to Honolulu Airport, you'll find Ke'ehi Lagoon, a place popular among paddlers.
The Pulama Hoe Canoe Club practices here four times a week.
It's also where this venomous snake was found floating in the water near shore."It was just surprising, but after the rains there's all kind of unexpected things we find," said Marcus Edayan, Pulama Hoe Canoe Club Coach."I want to see, whoa there, that's not a snake.""I think that's gross."The snake was taken to the Waikiki Aquarium, where biologists identified it as a "yellow bellied sea snake." They're very rare to Hawaii, with only three found in the past decade. "Usually when they are found in shore like, this they are seriously compromised or sick or dying something is wrong with them, otherwise if they're healthy they would be far, far off shore," said Norton T.M. Chan, Waikiki Aquarium Biologist.
This sea snake, measuring just over a foot long, was in bad shape.
You can see, it was apparently bitten by a fish or some other sea creature.
Officials decided to euthanize it."It had no chance. If it was still in the wild it would be dead," said Chan.Yellow bellied sea snakes are generally found in the warm waters of the Pacific and Indian oceans.
They paralyze their prey by injecting venom through their fangs. "I so hope there's not anymore in there.""I'm happy they found it noon time instead of when we start at 4pm. With us paddling, who knows what could've happened to the keikis," said Chan.Officials say if you see a yellow bellied sea snake, or any snake for that matter, don't touch it, even it appears to be dead.
You should call the authorities, like the State DLNR.

description.hltext_display: Case against ex-Milford cop accused in crash that killed 2 Orange teens heading to trial as talks prove fruitless (video and warrant)
description.content:
Ashlie Krakowski and David Servin
By Brian McCready, Milford Bureau Chief, bmccready@nhregister.com
FOLLOW: @nhrbmccready and FOLLOW: @nhrmilford
Jason Anderson
MILFORD An attorney representing former city police officer Jason Anderson, who was involved in a 2009 double fatal crash involving two Orange teens, said Tuesday the case is headed for a jury trial.
Attorney Hugh Keefe of New Haven said plea-bargain talks with the states attorneys office were not close at all after months of closed door discussions. Andersons criminal case is now headed for a jury trial, which may not take place for more than a year.
Anderson appeared in Superior Court Tuesday morning with his relatives and Keefe. After a brief closed-door meeting, Judge Richard Arnold said, Its my understanding negotiations were not fruitful, and this will go on the firm jury list.
See the Milford Police Department video of the crash:
Milford States Attorney Kevin Lawlor confirmed an offer had been made to Anderson, and Keefe said it has been rejected. Details of the offer were not made public.
Anderson has pleaded not guilty to two counts of second-degree manslaughter stemming from the early morning crash June 13, 2009, on the Boston Post Road in Orange that killed two 19-year-old Orange teens, Ashlie Krakowski and David Servin.
Anderson was traveling 94 mph when his car slammed into the car carrying Servin and Krakowski, which was turning left onto Dogwood Road from the Post Road, according to a state police report. On Dec. 14, 2009, the Board of Police Commissioners fired Anderson and suspended another officer, Richard Pisani, for speeding.
Some cases just call on to be tried, and I believe this is one of them, Keefe said.
See Keefe talk about the case here: Continued...
Reader Comments
View reader comments (0) Comment on this story
He also reiterated the possibility of seeking a change of venue.
Some cases are so notorious and have received so much publicity everywhere that it doesnt make much sense to transfer from one judicial district to another, if theyve had the same saturation in that other judicial district. Im not sure if this case is one of them, Keefe said.
The Hayes case is definitely one of those cases where it doesnt matter where it is tried, added Keefe. Im not sure this one is (one of those cases).
Keefe declined to comment on what his accident reconstruction expert has uncovered by examining the two vehicles involved in the crash. He said the state and his defense team will continue their respective investigations.
Some cases are (not) amenable to plea bargaining, and this is that type of case, Keefe said.
The double-fatal accident was captured on Pisanis in-dash video camera. A GPS-based speedometer readout on the video shows Pisanis cruiser was passed by Andersons police car, while Pisani was driving 65 mph. Pisani continued to accelerate, reaching 72 mph, just before the crash.
Anderson and Pisani were not responding to an emergency call at the time of the fatal crash. They were returning to Milford after assisting West Haven police at a nightclub.
Sources have told the New Haven Register that Servin and Krakowski both had blood alcohol content above the legal limit for an adult when they were struck by Andersons police cruiser. The teens attended a house party in Milford the night of the accident.
The estates of both teens intend to file a civil lawsuit against the officers and the city. Continued...
Reader Comments

description.hltext_display: Sauberer Strom vom Dach
description.content: Lilienthal. Auf dem Dach einer Lilienthaler Grundschule entsteht das erste Brgersolarkraftwerk der Gemeinde. Initiatoren sind die Kommune, die Wirtschaftsbetriebe Lilienthal GmbH sowie die Osterholzer Stadtwerke. Brger knnen sich als Darlehensgeber mit Anteilen von 500 bis 2500 Euro an der Investition beteiligen. Die Betreiber zahlen das Kapital und berschsse zurck. Teile der Anlage sollen noch in diesem Jahr installiert werden. Das Solarkraftwerk umfasst 240 Sonnenkollektoren, soll rund 130000 Euro kosten und pro Jahr 37 000 Kilowattstunden Strom produzieren, der 20 Jahre lang zu einer festen Vergtung nach dem Erneuerbaren Energien Gesetz (EEG) in das Stromnetz eingespeist wird. Bei einer Sonnenscheindauer von jhrlich 1500 Stunden sowie Abzgen fr Versicherungen, Rcklagen und Verwaltungsaufwand kann ein 1000-Euro-Anteilseigner nach 20 Jahren mit einer Rckzahlung von insgesamt rund 1500 Euro rechnen. Die Solaranlage sei keine Maschine zum Geldverdienen, der kologische Aspekt stehe im Vordergrund, stellte Stadtwerke-Geschftsfhrer Christian Meyer-Hammerstrm zum Projekt fest.

description.hltext_display: Nouveau primtre de scurit Canada-.-U: Brian Mulroney plaide en faveur
description.author: La Presse Canadienne
description.content: OTTAWA - L'ancien premier ministre du Canada, Brian Mulroney, croit qu'une nouvelle entente avec les tats-Unis pour la mise en place d'un primtre de scurit nord-amricain ne menace pas la souverainet du pays et fournit une police d'assurance l'conomie canadienne.

description.hltext_display: UN keeps troops in Ivory Coast, defying President Gbagbo
description.content:
ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast -- World powers voted Monday to keep UN forces in Ivory Coast, defying incumbent Laurent Gbagbo's demand they leave, and the UN peacekeeping chief said the troops would shoot back if fired on.
Gbagbo faces growing international pressure after European Union countries agreed to impose a travel ban on him and his entourage for failing to step down after a Nov. 28 election the outside world says he lost. The United States said it was also readying sanctions and repeated its call for Gbagbo to stand down. "It is time for him to go," White House spokesman Robert Gibbs said.
Rival claimant Alassane Ouattara is backed by the United Nations, African leaders, Washington and the European Union but Gbagbo still controls the army in a power struggle that has raised fears of civil war resuming in the world's top cocoa grower.
The UN Security Council unanimously adopted a resolution keeping its peacekeeping mission in place for six more months -- a normal extension period. The Council urged the mission "to support, in co-ordination with the Ivorian authorities,
the provision of security for the government and key political stakeholders."
In a separate statement, it warned that anyone responsible for attacks on civilians or peacekeepers could be hauled before an international tribunal.
Noting violence that has already claimed over 50 lives since the contested election, the Council urged the force to fulfill a mandate to protect civilians. But it was not immediately clear that it represented the toughening of the mandate that Ouattara has called for.
Peacekeeping chief Alain Le Roy said the UN troops were ready to open fire in self-defence and to defend their mandate, which includes the protection of civilians.
"We have the right to open fire in the case of self-defence or in defence of the mandate," Le Roy told Reuters in a telephone interview.
"There have already been some attacks on our peacekeepers, and we had to fire back."
Gbagbo's government repeated demands for the force, which first arrived in Ivory Coast in 2004, to leave.

description.hltext_display: Tuesday's NHL Roundup: A look at Tuesday's games
description.content:
Los Angeles Kings , NHL , Avalanche , Colorado , Los Angeles , St. Louis
The highest-scoring team in the NHL was no match for Jonathan Quick and the Los Angeles Kings defence.
Quick stopped 23 shots for his third shutout of the season, Dustin Brown had two goals and two assists, and the Kings beat Colorado 5-0 on Tuesday night to end the Avalanche's six-game winning streak.
Colorado leads the NHL with 121 goals but couldn't solve Quick or the Kings. Los Angeles didn't give the Avalanche many opportunities, and the chances they had were gobbled up.
"This might have been the best 60 minutes we've played all year," Quick said.
It came at a good time for the Kings, who won three times on their five-game road trip. All three wins were by five goals, including a 5-0 win at Detroit on Dec. 13.
"Overall this trip was a tough one with the teams we were playing," Brown said. "We were a little disappointed in our efforts, especially in St. Louis and Chicago, but looking back, taking three out of five isn't bad."
Elsewhere in the NHL it was: San Jose 2 Edmonton 1; Columbus 3 Calgary 1; Dallas 5 Montreal 2; Washington 5 New Jersey 1; Buffalo 5 Anaheim 2; and St. Louis 4 Atlanta 2.
At Rob Scuderi had a goal and an assist, Brad Richardson scored a goal, and Anze Kopitar and Drew Doughty had two assists apiece for the Kings.
Craig Anderson had 27 saves for Colorado, which was shut out for the first time this season. The last time the Avalanche were blanked was a 3-0 loss at Los Angeles on Feb. 13 a span of 55 games.
"They're probably one of the top-ranked power plays and the highest-scoring offence in the league, and at times they did get pressure, but we still managed to keep the scoring chances to a minimum," Quick said.
The Kings took a 1-0 lead in the first period on Scuderi's first of the season. Anderson saved Scuderi's initial shot from the point, but the puck ricocheted to the right circle where Scuderi picked it up and slid a backhander past Anderson with 7:34 left.
"I think he had three or four shots on that shift," Kings coach Terry Murray said. "You keep putting pucks to the net, a lot of traffic, you find a way to get it done."
It stayed that way until early in the second period. Doughty took a shot from the top of the right circle that Richardson deflected past Anderson with the blade of his stick to make it 2-0 with 13:29 remaining.
It was Richardson's fifth goal, and fourth against Colorado.
"He's a bit of an Avs killer, I guess," Brown said.
Both goalies made big saves. Quick stopped Matt Duchene on a chance midway through the second, and Anderson made key stops late in the period. The last came on Kopitar's shot from the left with a minute remaining in the period.
"Quickie had to make maybe two really difficult saves, and he made them," Brown said. "That might have been our best 60 minutes, especially on the defensive side of the puck."
Duchene nearly spoiled the shutout midway through the third but his wrist shot from the left circle rattled off the post. Quick covered the rebound.
"Their goalie played very well for them," Duchene said. "He made some huge saves, and they got some bounces, too. It's a tough loss."
Brown iced the game with two goals in the third period, his 12th and 13th. Justin Williams scored a power-play goal with 2:11 left, his 12th goal of the season.
"We didn't dictate the type of game that we wanted," Colorado coach Joe Sacco said. "They did."
Sharks 2 Oilers 1
At San Jose, Calif., Logan Couture and Dan Boyle scored 3:28 apart in the second period, leading the Sharks past Edmonton.
---
Blue Jackets 3 Flames 1
At Columbus, Ohio, Mathieu Garon made 29 saves in his debut as the Blue Jackets' No. 1 goalie, and Columbus snapped a four-game losing streak by beating Calgary.
---
Stars 5 Canadiens 2
At Dallas, Jamie Benn scored a short-handed goal, Brad Richards added a power-play tally, and the surging Stars beat Montreal.
---
Capitals 5 Devils 1
At Washington, Andrew Gordon had a goal and assist for his first two NHL points, and the Capitals earned their second straight victory by beating New Jersey.
---
Sabres 5 Ducks 2
At Buffalo, N.Y., Tyler Ennis scored two goals to lift the Sabres over Anaheim.
---
Blues 4 Thrashers 2
At Atlanta, Ty Conklin stopped 37 shots, Alexander Steen gave St. Louis the lead with a goal late in the second period, and the Blues beat the Thrashers.

description.hltext_display: Croydon firefighters dance on ice
description.author: Harry Miller
description.content:
Firefighters from Croydon have been dipping their toes in the icy water of Clapham Common Pond.
Fire crews have been gearing up for the latests cold snap by training for rescues from freezing lakes and ponds.
Their training exercise was a chance for the firefighters to brush up on their water rescue skills and an opportunity to warn people about the dangers of walking on frozen ponds.
During the exercise a firefighter, who was wearing a wet suit and protective clothing, entered the frozen pond, whilst his colleagues, using specialist water rescue equipment, including inflatable boats, rescued him.
Station manager David ONeill, one of the Brigades water rescue specialists, who was at the scene, said: We wanted to show people how incredibly dangerous it is to walk on frozen ponds and lakes.
"Its virtually impossible to tell how thick the ice is and if you fall in, you wont survive for long in these conditions.
Wed urge people to stay well away from frozen water.
"If you have a dog, please keep it on a lead as the vast majority of people we get called out to are those who have fallen through the ice after theyve followed their dog.
With a new series of Dancing on Ice coming up wed also like to remind people interested in ice skating to practice their skills on professional ice rinks, not frozen ponds.
If you see someone in danger on the ice, or even in the water, call 999. Firefighters will attend and will use specialist equipment to get you out quickly and safely.

description.hltext_display: U.K. police nab 12 men in raids
description.content:
LONDON -- Twelve men were arrested across Britain on Monday in counter-terrorism raids described by a senior police officer as essential to protect the public from the threat of an attack.
John Yates, Britain's most senior counter-terrorism officer, said the men were held on suspicion of the "commission, preparation, or instigation of an act of terrorism in the U.K." The BBC said in an unsourced report that the arrests were linked to an investigation into al-Qaidainspired attacks within Britain. The inquiry was led by the MI5 domestic-security agency.

description.hltext_display: Travel nightmare drags on
description.content:
BERLIN/LONDON -- Snow and freezing temperatures grounded flights and disrupted road and rail links across northern Europe on Monday, stranding travellers and closing schools.
Only one of two runways at London Heathrow, the world's busiest international airport, was operating after a weekend snowstorm, forcing thousands to camp out in terminals. More than 1,000 flights at German airports in Frankfurt, Munich and Berlin were cancelled, disrupting business and Christmas holiday plans. Freezing temperatures were expected to continue in Britain and Scandinavia for much of this week. Most of the rest of Europe is forecast to warm up in coming days, although a drop back to sub-zero levels is likely next week. For some, the snowfall was welcome. Children's sleds were sold out in Germany.
"This much snow is only fun if you're a kid," said Berlin lawyer Katja-Julia Fischer, 42. "It's getting on my nerves."
The severe weather has hit retailers at the height of Christmas trading. Britain's biggest department store chain, John Lewis, said sales fell more than 10% on Saturday.
Some online retailers were declining new orders or cancelling existing ones because of delivery problems, according to the industry body IMRG.
Northern France was also covered by heavy snow, disrupting road and rail traffic as Parisians braved clogged highways to reach their holiday destinations.
France's army deployed blue armoured personnel carriers on highways around Paris, where they used their horsepower to drag stranded cars out of ditches and back onto the road.
In Paris, children made snowmen on the whitened lawns in front of the Eiffel Tower. Snowboarders even took to the hills of northern Paris, an unusual sight in a city known for its rainy, temperate weather.
Brandi Gonzalez, a 27-year-old pre-school teacher from Connecticut, was stuck at Heathrow after waiting since Friday to fly to New York with her husband and son.
"All I'm getting is 'We will help you as much as we can'. It's a two-hour wait on the phone to rebook a flight. Today I sat on the phone for two hours to get hung up on. They said 'We still don't have another flight', and I got hung up on."
The German carrier Lufthansa said it was confident it would operate a full service by Wednesday.
Air France said there were serious delays to passenger flights and cargo operations at the two main Paris airports, Charles de Gaulle and Orly, after a snowstorm on Monday.
The weather forced Eurostar to impose speed limits on its cross-Channel trains between Britain and France, adding up to two hours to journey times.

description.hltext_display: Extra police deployed in Argentinian capital
description.content:
BUENOS AIRES -- Argentine President Cristina Fernandez ordered the deployment Monday of 6,000 military police to the capital's sprawling outskirts after violence linked to squatter invasions alarmed officials.
Three people were killed this month during clashes between neighborhood residents and thousands of squatters who set up tents in a city park to demand housing in the capital's Villa Soldati district. The violence presented Fernandez with her biggest challenge since the Oct. 27 death of her powerful husband, former President Nestor Kirchner, and critics accused her center-left administration of mishandling the incident.
Fernandez, who announced the creation of a Security Ministry a week after the unrest, sought to further underline her commitment to fighting crime and maintaining law and order Monday by announcing the deployment of the extra police.
"The right to live peacefully, without crime, is the right of every citizen," said Fernandez, who supports a controversial decision by the new security minister to ban police from using firearms and rubber bullets at demonstrations.
"You can't advance in the same way when you're dealing with organized criminals and social demonstrations, even when these demonstrators behave in a way that shouldn't be imitated," Fernandez said in a televised speech.
Fernandez, a vocal human rights defender, advocates moderate use of police force, but some rightist rivals say a tougher approach is needed to fight crime -- including the land occupations.

Yesterday, the shares gained 3.91%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $13.72 on volume of 4.5 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of Blackstone are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $13.56 and above their 200-day MA of $12.31. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.

description.hltext_display: Family flees house after washing machine fire
description.author: Omar Oakes
description.content:
A grandmother and two children had to be evacuated from their home after a defective washing machine went up in flames.
Firefighters were called to the house in Commonside East, Mitcham Common, on Monday where the washing machine caused considerable damage to the kitchen.
Mitcham fire stations crew manager said the grandmother and her two grandchildren were lucky to escape without injury as the house was not fitted with a smoke alarm.
Crew manager David Simpson said: "The fire brigade will supply smoke alarms for free and residents can do this by calling us. The phone number is on the side of our fire engines.
"We will also do a free fire safety check for any resident who wants one."

event_or_fact.property: The fire brigade will supply smoke alarms for free and residents can do this by calling us.

description.hltext_display: Belarus leader takes anti-West line
description.content:
MINSK -- Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko vowed on Monday to thwart any attempt at "revolution" after police broke up mass protests against his reelection and arrested his opponents.
In a defiant speech following western criticism of Sunday night's crackdown on opposition rallies, Lukashenko said there would be no more "senseless democracy" in Belarus. At least seven out of his nine election challengers and hundreds of opposition demonstrators were being held in detention after the crackdown and an early morning sweep of homes of known dissidents by KGB state security officers.
They included his main challenger, Vladimir Neklyayev, a 64-year-old poet. He was arrested while recovering in hospital after being beaten on Sunday night by police, his wife said.
Lukashenko, 56, who has ruled Belarus with an iron fist since 1994, was officially declared victor with nearly 80% of the vote after a night of mayhem in central Minsk involving riot police and thousands of demonstrators.
The opposition said the vote was rigged and the real level of support was far lower. A European observer mission said the vote count had been flawed and the police action heavy-handed.
"There will be no revolution or criminality in Belarus," he told a marathon news conference, adding that security forces had resisted "banditry" and militants bent on destruction.

description.hltext_display: Chuck Bennett: Weekend of Giving' raises funds for THAW
description.author: Chuck Bennett
description.content:
Chuck Bennett: Society
'Weekend of Giving' raises funds for THAW
In an effort to help more than 1 million needy people in Michigan pay their utility bills, DTE Energy and the Heat and Warmth Fund sponsored a "Weekend of Giving," starting with THAW's annual signature event, "Night of Warm Hearts," on Dec. 10.
Held at the Westin Book Cadillac, about 400 people, paying $165 each, attended the party, which included a strolling dinner with a Beijing rice station, a macaroni and cheese bar and international meatball and cupcake stations. Lively and soulful entertainment was provided by Modern Tribe, featuring Gwen and Charles Scales, and there were also live and silent auctions, which together raised more than $20,000.
The evening began with a VIP reception, where speakers from DTE Energy along with City of Detroit Group Executive Karla Henderson, who presented awards to Straight Gate and Perfecting churches, along with an award to DTE.
The Weekend of Giving also included a gospel concert on Saturday night titled "Hallelujah for Heat" at Second Ebenezer Church. Nearly 3,000 members of the community were given free tickets to the inspirational concert that featured local and national acts, headlined byDeitrick Haddon and the Voices of Unity with special guest Tramaine Hawkins.
The last leg of the series was "Customer Assistance Day," held at Cobo Center on Dec. 13, where 350 DTE Energy employees, joined by representatives from human services, wellness, and credit and housing agencies, worked one-on-one with 3,000 customers to connect them with assistance and resources for which they qualified.
DTE wants to establish a $1 million energy assistance emergency fund.
Chuck Bennett is a Metro Detroit freelance writer who covers society and fashion. Follow him on

description.hltext_display: MP Ed Davey among latest caught up in political controversy
description.author: Paul Jones
description.content:
Kingston and Surbiton MP Ed Davey is among the latest Liberal Democrats to be recorded expressing concern over coalition government policies.
Mr Davey, a business minister, has been quoted as saying he was "gobsmacked" by a decision to cut child benefits to for higher-rate taxpayers.
He is quoted in the Daily telegraph today along with MP for Berwickshire Michael Moore and Steve Webb, MP for Thornbury and Yate.
Yesterday, Business Secretary Vince Cable, Liberal Democrat MP for Twickenham, lost powers to control a bid by Rupert Murdoch to take control of BSkyB after telling undercover reporters he had "declared war" on the media tycoon.
Now, Mr Davey is said to have told reporters posing as constituents he felt plans to limit housing benefit would affect those who could least afford it.
He said: "Their housing benefit cuts are going to mean, in my view, if they go through, that some people who are on the breadline will be put below the breadline and that's just deeply unacceptable."
Cuts in child benefit had come "out of the blue", he added.
"I had no knowledge of it and suddenly they announced it and I have to say I was as shocked as everyone else," he said.
"I mean, I'm going to lose about 1,000 a year. And I was, frankly, gobsmacked when it came."

description.hltext_display: Mariah Carey happy with pregnancy well-wishers
description.author: Bangshowbiz
description.content: Mariah Carey's faith in humanity has been "restored" thanks to the good wishes of the general public about her pregnancy. The 'Hero' hitmaker - who is expecting twins with TV presenter Nick Cannon - had been reluctant to announce her happy news but is glad she received a positive response from fans. She said: "Obviously I'm very thankful for this moment. Since Nick and I made our announcement, people have been very congratulatory. "We didn't really want to talk about this yet, but I'm in the public eye and really didn't have a choice. "So I'm just thankful I can go through this time and feel a lot of warmth. It's restored my faith in people a bit." Nick revealed the pair are expecting twins earlier this month, joking he would probably get "yelled" at for letting the information go public, despite weeks of speculation. He said: "In order for my wife and I to have our life, we need to be up front and I need to be able to share things with you and be real. "I didn't even tell my wife I was gonna do this. I'm probably gonna get yelled at for not getting permission... We are having twins."

description.hltext_display: Marvel Announces 2011 Event: Fear Itself
description.content:
The House of Ideas pulls back the curtain on their next event series.
Yesterday at Midtown Comics in Times Square, New York City, Marvel busted down the doors on their next event series: Fear Itself. This event spins out of the recent Marvel teasers that have hinted at a threat that is much more personal for Marvels heroes. Fear Itself will also be a series that is a reflection of the rough economic times we currently live in.
The series will be written by Matt Fraction with art by Stuart Immonen. Fear Itself will kick off in April 2011 and run seven issues total. Matt Fraction says Fear Itself is the biggest Marvel story ever. The story will see eight worthy heroes chosen to take on the God of Fear, himself.
Below you can find the official teaser trailer for Fear Itself, as well as a video diary by series creator Matt Fraction, recorded from the writers bunker.

description.hltext_display: Forclosures in Alaska
description.content: Foreclosures have increased 9.2 percent in Alaska according to forclosure tracking group Realty Trac. Alaska still ranks 34th out of the 50 states with only 1 in 1075 homes going back to the bank at present.Nevada ranks number one with 1 in 99 homes in trouble. Days on market are down from 113 last year to 93 days in 2010.The prices on residential units in the Anchorage market at up 2.81 percent over 2009.According to Re-Max Associate Broker Anthony Borgess things are very stable. "We are seeing trends that point toward lower market times and higher prices which if we can keep this trend going, it's going to make 2011 a good year for Real Estate"The average price of a home in Anchorage is $329,500.

description.hltext_display: EconomiaAcordo prev reserva no Oramento para possvel aumento do mnimo
description.content:
Um acordo construdo na Comisso Mista de Oramento (CMO) pode permitir que o Executivo amplie o salrio mnimo em 2011 para alm dos R$ 540 que constam na proposta de Oramento do prximo ano. O aumento seria possvel graas a uma espcie de "reserva especial" de R$ 6,6 bilhes, apelidada de colcho, que, no entanto, no ter apenas esta finalidade.
Segundo o vice-lder do governo no Congresso, Gilmar Machado (PT-MG), R$ 1 bilho desta reserva est separado para atender a uma possvel ampliao ou reajuste dos benefcios do Bolsa Famlia. O restante ficaria para outras demandas como o pagamento de dvidas judiciais com aposentados e pensionistas, que so estimadas em at R$ 2 bilhes.
Estamos acertando com as centrais e com os sindicalistas que vai se poder usar o colcho para dar o aumento do salrio mnimo. Ns vamos abrir essa possibilidade e a eles vo tentar convencer o Executivo, afirmou Machado, ressaltando que na pea oramentria permanecer o valor de R$ 540.
Caso os R$ 5,6 bilhes da reserva "colcho" fossem realmente investidos em um aumento do salrio mnimo, seria possvel ampliar o valor para cerca de R$ 560. O presidente da Fora Sindical e deputado federal, Paulinho da Fora (PDT-SP), porm, adianta que as centrais continuaro a defender o valor de R$ 580. Ele afirmou que a possibilidade de a reserva destinar recursos pode ajudar na tarefa de convencer o Executivo.
No houve negociao, ento ns no vamos abrir mo destes R$ 580. a primeira vez que o presidente Lula no nos chamou para negociar, afirmou o deputado sindicalista.
Mesmo se for cumprido o cronograma e o Oramento for aprovado at esta quarta-feira, o governo ter de editar uma Medida Provisria para que o reajuste seja concedido a partir de janeiro. Paulinho j adianta que quando ela chegar ao Congresso receber uma emenda de sua autoria para tentar elevar o valor para R$ 580.
Outra polmica futura que o deputado j adianta em relao ao reajuste para aposentados e pensionistas que recebem mais de um salrio mnimo. O reajuste previsto no Oramento apenas da inflao, de 5,5%, mas Paulinho quer elevar o percentual para 10%.
O cronograma dos trabalhos prev a votao do Oramento ainda nesta tera-feira na comisso, mas existe a possibilidade de que tudo fique para a quarta-feira, ltimo dia de trabalho no Congresso neste ano.

description.hltext_display: Gulf oil spill voted top story
description.content:
The oil spill received 54 first-place votes out of 180 ballots cast for the top 10 stories. The health care bill was next, with 30 first-place votes. The U.S. election was third.
In fourth place was the U.S. economy, which had been voted the top story of 2009. Gulf oil disaster: The April 20 explosion at a BP-leased rig killed 11 workers and unleashed a deep-sea spill that ultimately spewed at least 170 million gallons of crude into the Gulf. Consequences included devastation for fishing and tourism industries, a huge and costly cleanup effort, a management change at BP and creation of a $20 billion fund to pay for damages.
Health care overhaul: After bitter political wrangling, President Obama was able to sign into law one of his major campaign promises ? a $1 trillion health care overhaul intended to expand coverage to more Americans. But Republicans used public misgivings about parts of the plan as a springboard for election gains, and the overhaul faced a welter of lawsuits challenging its constitutionality.
U.S. elections: President Obama called it a shellacking ? an election in which the Republicans surged to a majority in the House of Representatives and gained more governors offices and legislative majorities. The Democrats were able to hang onto their edge in the Senate, leaving the U.S. with at least two years of divided government.
U.S. economy: Economists said the deepest recession since the Great Depression was over, and consumers began to spend more as the year neared a close. But the unemployment rate stayed well above 9 percent, and home prices were weighed down by foreclosures and sluggish demand.
Haiti earthquake: Already the Western Hemispheres most destitute nation, Haiti was shattered by an earthquake on Jan. 12 that killed at least 230,000 and left millions homeless. Crucial reconstruction projects were slow to get started; disease and political instability added to the woes.
Tea party movement: Though it lacked the trappings of traditional political organizations, the tea party movement had a profound impact on the 2010 election, influencing the stances of Republican leaders and enabling some maverick challengers to oust GOP establishment candidates in the primaries.
Chile mine rescue: In a year of disasters and squabbles, this was a miraculous feel-good story. Trapped nearly a half-mile underground for 69 days after an Aug. 5 mine collapse, 33 Chilean miners were freed one-by-one while an entranced global audience watched on television.
Iraq: U.S. forces formally ended their combat role and looked ahead to planned withdrawal, while Iraqis endured months of bitter political haggling after an election that failed to heal Sunni-Shiite divisions.
WikiLeaks: First came the online postings of a huge batch of U.S. military documents from Iraq and Afghanistan. Then WikiLeaks started releasing a cache of classified State Department diplomatic cables, creating embarrassment for Washington in its dealings with other nations.
Afghanistan: After months of deliberation, President Obama ordered a troop surge in a major bid to turn the tide of the nearly 10-year-old war. Intense fighting pushed the Taliban out of some longtime strongholds, but the militants remained resilient, and Afghanistan remained beset by corruption and ineffectual government.
It was a year of dramatic and diverse news events.
Jessica Runnels Rourk, an editor at the Post and Courier in Charleston, S.C., said the health care overhaul was a catalyst for other major political events. Conservative anger over the law gave rise to the tea party movement, and the law itself became a symbol of the lack of bipartisanship in Congress that cost incumbents from both parties in Novembers elections, she noted on her ballot.
Among the stories that didnt make the top 10 were Arizonas enactment of a tough law against illegal immigration, the European fiscal crisis, a Supreme Court ruling freeing corporations and unions to fund election ads targeting candidates, floods in Pakistan that affected 20 million people, and the volcanic eruption in Iceland that caused trans-Atlantic air travel chaos.

description.hltext_display: Anuncio de la Conselleria de Agricultura, Pesca y Alimentacin sobre citacin para notificacin por comparecencia de la resolucin del expte: 46.128/10, cuyo titular es Christian Galea Marn
BrasilEmpresas areas afirmam que no haver greve, mesmo com o fracasso das negociaes
description.content:
Mesmo com o fracasso das negociaes, as empresas areas ainda apostam que a greve do prximo dia 23, antevspera do Natal, no vai ocorrer. O consultor do Sindicato Nacional das Empresas Areas (Snea), Odilon Junqueira, disse que haver negociao com os trabalhadores. No se pode deixar a sociedade refm de uma negociao como essa. No h o menor cabimento em fazer uma greve no dia 23 de dezembro.
Segundo ele, as companhias areas apresentaram uma proposta nova de reajuste de 6,5%. As empresas, preocupadas com a situao, fizeram a proposta de mudar a data-base para maio, com isso, aeronautas e aerovirios teriam um novo reajuste com a variao integral do INPC (ndice Nacional de Preos ao Consumidor), assegurado a partir de 1 de maio. Essa a posio final das empresas.
Junqueira garantiu que as empresas esto dispostas a negociar. Temos a convico de que nossos funcionrios no faro uma paralisao na vspera do Natal, seria uma atitude completamente sem sentido. O Snea continua aberto a negociaes e achamos que no bom para ningum uma greve no Natal.
Para o procurador-geral do Ministrio Pblico, Otvio Brito Lopes, a reunio desta tera-feira mostrou uma boa-vontade das partes em chegar a um acordo. H um distanciamento muito grande entre as propostas, tanto das empresas, quanto dos trabalhadores. A posio do Ministrio Pblico aguardar os acontecimentos e, ocorrendo a greve, a principal preocupao com a sociedade e como ela ser atendida.
De acordo com Lopes, o Ministrio Pblico vai acompanhar o movimento grevista para garantir a legalidade da paralisao. Caso ocorra a necessidade de julgamento de alguma medida cautelar, o Ministrio Pblico estar de planto e o Tribunal Superior do Trabalho, que julga o movimento, tem sempre um ministro de planto.
A Agncia Nacional de Aviao Civil (Anac), que no participou da reunio, informou que a questo salarial no de competncia da agncia. No entanto, a Anac analisa os planos de contingncia que as empresas areas entregaram para o caso de haver greve na prxima quinta-feira.

description.hltext_display: Algots hus planerar nytt bostadsomrde
description.content: Algots hus ab vill gra en detaljplanering av sina gor i sterkalmare i Jomala. Omrdet skall anvndas fr bostder men i nulget, utan byggnadsplan, kan inte ngra tomter styckas. Kommunstyrelsen i Jomala har sagt ja till Algots Hus anskan men under frutsttning att Mariehamns stad gr med p att fastigheten Norrbacka ocks inkluderas i detaljplanen. Kommunen vill ha en mer trafiksker vg till bde lageromrdet och det nya bostadsomrdet genom att stnga den befintliga infarten frn Lemlandsvgen och i stllet bygga en ny frn Igelkottsvgen. Jomala krver ocks att markgarna str fr planlggningskostnaderna och att man har ett frdigt markanvndningsavtal innan fullmktige fattar det slutgiltiga beslutet. Omrdet kommer att planeras av arkitekt Tiina Holmberg . (tt-s)

description.hltext_display: Spider-Man 650 - Review
description.content:
Im not really sure what to think of Amazing Spider-Man #650. I was all aboard for the Big Time story arc when it launched, but now cracks in the hull of the story are leading me to believe the whole thing might sink if the situation isnt rectified. The main problem is Marvel trying to do too much and all the bells and whistles are detracting from the over all story. This should be about Peter Parker climbing back into some kind of decent life and battling foes, traditional Spider-Man stuff that would cleanse the pallet after a few years of Brand New Day. The launch of Big Time seemed to focus on that but now, a few issues in, that focus has become hazy.
First off we have the new Spider-Man costume, which can only lead to one question, why? Why does Marvel keep introducing new costumes when it never really works out for them? The black costume was a shot in the dark, a chance happening that resonated with the fans. Its not going to happen again, so stop forcing it. This time at least Marvel has scaled back the outfit so were not faced with another atrocious Iron Man rip off. In issue 650 Peter Parker designs the new outfit after being trounced by the new Hobgoblin. In short hes going tit for tat with technology.
That brings us to the second problem, the Hobgoblin. Im not sure why Marvel has decided to turn this variation (its Phil Urich this time, not Roderkick Kingsley) into their version of the Joker, but its annoying as hell. Watching the Hobgoblin laugh like a hyena, act all craaazy and taunt Spider-Man in the exact same way the Joker taunts Batman, is a lesson in frustration. Its also a little much that the new Hobgoblin is doing all of this to get a girl. Really? Cmon Marvel, lets step it up a bit. Oh and on a side note, the fact that Hobgoblins face looks like the mis-print Yoda from the Empire Strikes Back movie comic is really hard to ignore. Fellow Star Wars geeks will feel my pain.
Issue 650 doesnt stop there with parade of unnecessary elements. Wilson Fisk is along for the ride, as is Black Cat and the ultimate loose end Mary Jane. I hate to mess with tradition but its time for Mary Jane to go, leave town, hit the runways of Paris and be out of Peters life. This seems like a transparent way for Marvel to keep her in the loop in case they need a sales boost and bring them back together. With Mary Jane around theres no importance on Peter Parkers new love Carlie, which kills any kind of investment in the character.
I dont blame writer Dan Slott, hes doing the best he can with what hes given. Humberto Ramos art is good this time, but lacks the off-the-page style of the last few issues. Id hate to think that Big Time is already out of steam, so Im going to hold out for a better turn around. Nothing horrifically wrong is happening; Marvel just needs to back it down a notch. Pull the Hobgoblin back a bit and let him become his own character, not a facsimile of the Joker. Take Mary Jane out of the equation, at least for a while, and streamline whats going on. Big Time is a great idea and one that will write itself if its allowed to breathe and grow naturally.

description.hltext_display: Backers of 9/11 health bill expect to prevail in key Senate test vote on Wednesday
description.content:
Published on December 22nd, 2010
Topics :
World Trade Center , WASHINGTON , New York
WASHINGTON - The Senate is headed for a key test vote on a bill that would provide up to $6.2 billion to aid people who became sick after being exposed to toxins at the World Trade Center ruins.
Bill supporters say they're confident they have the 60 votes needed to prevail on the vote expected Wednesday. But they worry that Republicans who oppose the measure could try to stall a final vote as the holidays near and the current session of Congress winds down.
The bill would provide medical and economic benefits over 10 years to survivors and responders to the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.
It also would have to be approved by the House. New York lawmakers are pressing the House to remain in session for the vote.
