description.hltext_display: U.S. population nearly 10 percent larger than in 2000, census data show
description.content:
WASHINGTON The U.S. population has reached an all-time high, and Texas was the big winner among eight states that will gain seats in Congress, according to the first data released from the 2010 census.
Commerce Secretary Gary Locke delivered the first results of the 23rd national census to President Barack Obama on Tuesday morning.
The decennial head count shows that the official U.S. population is 308,745,538, nearly 10 percent larger than the 2000 census total of 281,421,906.
The 9.7 percent population growth from 2000 to 2010 was the second-lowest of the past century, trailing only the 7.3 percent growth from 1930 to 1940, the height of the Great Depression.
Census Bureau Director Robert Groves couldn't estimate how much the current economic woes have contributed to the past decade's slow rate of growth.
But William Frey, a demographer with the Brookings Institution, a research center in Washington, said the economy was a key factor in slowing the growth of legal and illegal immigrants since 2006.
"The housing market crashed, jobs were hard to come by and people stopped coming," Frey said of many immigrants.
Groves said that an estimated 60 percent of the 27.3 million new U.S. residents since 2000 were the products of births to U.S. residents, while the rest stemmed from immigration. The census doesn't ask about a person's legal status, so Groves had no new estimate on the percentage of U.S. residents who are illegal immigrants. Other agencies have estimated the illegal immigrant population at about 11 million.
Census data help determine how more than $4 trillion will be divided among state, local and tribal governments over the next 10 years. The findings also inform public policy decisions on transportation, public health, senior services and neighborhood improvements.
In addition to determining how much state and federal funding will go to individual communities for the next 10 years, 2010 census population figures determine which states will gain or lose seats in Congress.
Texas added nearly 4.3 million residents from 2000 to 2010, and that 21 percent growth rate will give the Lone Star State four new members of Congress.
California, which leads all states with 53 congressional seats, didn't gain one for the first time in its 160-year history as a state. Because of its high unemployment, budget problems and struggling housing market, Frey said California was becoming a "redistributor of population to the rest of the West" as people leave the Golden State for better economic opportunities in nearby states.
The shift nationally is likely to benefit Republicans, since most of the states that are gaining seats are GOP strongholds.
In addition, Obama arguably will have a tougher road to re-election, since the reapportionment changes amount to a loss of six electoral votes in states that he carried in the 2008 election.
Despite predictions of low response rates among citizens because of the recession and supposed anger at the federal government, the 2010 census matched the 2000 head count, with 74 percent of households returning the questionnaires. The 2010 census also came in nearly $2 billion under budget.

Shania Twain excited about future
description.author: Bangshowbiz
description.content:
Shania Twain is optimistic about her future following her engagement. The 'Still The One' singer is set to marry Swiss businessman Frederic Thiebaud after he proposed two months ago and says she can't wait to get married because the couple are so in love. Shania was previously married to Robert 'Mutt' Lange but their 14-year union ended in May 2008 after he embarked on a relationship her friend and Frederic's ex-wife Marie-Anne Thiebaud and she has said that experience has shown her who her true friends really are.
Shania - who has a nine-year-old son, Eja, with her ex - said: "In the last two and a half years of adjusting to life after separation and divorce, I needed to lean on others more often than I was accustomed to. These people have been gifts, and I am fortunate to have so many of these beautiful people - friends, family and beloved fans, who's support I cherish more deeply with each day that passes. Now another year is about to pass, and I would like to thank everyone who helped me believe that new beginnings are possible and that love can be trusted."

description.hltext_display: Will Al-Salehi repair relations?
description.content:
Author: Abdul Rahman Al-Rashid
It was notable that the first statement issued by the new Iranian Foreign Minister, Ali Akbar Salehi, focussed on the need to improve his country's relations with two of its neighbours: Saudi Arabia and Turkey. At a time when relations with Turkey are considered to be at their best for 30 years, relations with Saudi Arabia have reached a new low, and are likely to deteriorate further. Ousted minister Manouchehr Mottaki was not the cause of such deterioration, and thus it would be wrong to think that his dismissal would remove the obstacles between the two countries.
Two issues are behind this silent crisis: Firstly, there is rising Iranian influence in the Arab region. Hezbollah is besieging the Lebanese government and crippling the country, whilst in Gaza, Hamas is acting contrary to the interests of the Palestinian Authority. In Iraq, the winners of the recent government election have been marginalized by a coalition which Iran has imposed upon all Iraqis. Bahrain is suffering a state of disorder at the hands of groups affiliated to Iran, and the Iranians have also supported the Houthis in Yemen, who launched attacks against Saudi Arabia. All these incidents form a large map of Iranian activity in the Middle East, which is hostile towards Saudi Arabia. Secondly, there is the issue of the Iranian nuclear file, a subject in which Minister al-Salehi specializes. Irans nuclear capabilities are considered the primary threat to Saudi Arabia and other countries in the region.
Can the new minister do something about this mountain of complex problems between the two countries?
Certainly, Iran is the only party capable of ending the causes of tension between the two countries, or indeed with all countries in the region. Saudi Arabia has nothing more to offer. The Kingdom took the initiative in terms of reconciliation 10 years ago, when it changed its policy and restored relations with the governments of [Akbar Hashemi] Rafsanjani, and then [Mohammad] Khatami. Saudi Arabia also opened its airspace for flights between the two countries and hosted Iranian trade missions, contrary to American advice, which sought to tighten the grip on the Iranian government, and suspend its nuclear program. Unfortunately however, Tehran seemed to misinterpret these Saudi concessions. Subsequently, Iran turned into a savage monster in the Arab region, sheltering al-Qaeda leaders, and intensifying its development of nuclear weapons.
During the era of Minister Mottaki, relations did indeed deteriorate, but the minister himself was not responsible. Rather it was the policy of Ahmadinejad, who has persisted with his political manoeuvres, in a manner not witnessed in the Arab world since the 1960s.
Is it possible after all this to repair the broken relations? The matter has now gone beyond the capabilities of the new Iranian Foreign Minister, and has reached a stage where the intentions of the leadership in Tehran must change.

Agreement with works council in Montataire, France will allow Goss International to adjust capacity and strengthen competitiveness of European operations
description.author: Admin
description.content:
Tags: Goss International / Social
Goss International has agreed with the works council at its facility in Montataire, France on a social plan that will reduce the work force there by approximately 300 people. The plan, which will be enacted in 2011, will allow the company to adjust capacity according to market demand and improve the competitiveness of its European operations.
We regret the impact on our employees, but this is an essential, proactive step in our plan to rationalize and integrate Goss resources in Europe to deliver the highest level of value to our customers, according to Goss International president and CEO Jochen Meissner. Meissner emphasizes that Goss International maintains a global network that includes substantial manufacturing sites in Europe, America and Asia.
Goss International facilities in Europe include development, manufacturing and support centers for key Goss products. These include the Sunday 5000 press, the only 96-page web press model in production in the world, the unique M-600 Folia web-to-sheet perfecting press and the M-600, Sunday 4000, FPS, Universal and Uniliner presses as well as Goss splicers, pasters and heatset dryers.
Goss International supplies presses, finishing systems and aftermarket services for newspaper, commercial, packaging and specialized printing applications. The company is owned by Shanghai Electric, an international group with annual revenues of approximately $8 billion and a long-term commitment to industrial technology.
Goss, the Goss logo, Goss International, Sunday, M-600, Folia, FPS, Universal and Uniliner are trademarks or registered trademarks of Goss International Corporation or its affiliates.

description.hltext_display: Foodies fight with film school for space in LA
description.content:
Fans of the Hollywood Farmers Market are hoping for a permanent resolution to the permitting dispute that's been threatening the weekly produce bazaar.
Organizers have until mid-April to reach an accommodation with the adjacent film school that has been refusing to sign off on the market's permit. Los Angeles Film School officials say the market blocks an entryway into one of the school's parking lots for several hours each Sunday.
Organizers say shifting the stalls that block the lot to another part of the market would result in the loss of many vendors. They say that could cut back on revenue they use to support smaller markets in the city's poor neighborhoods.

description.hltext_display: EconomiaImpasse sobre remanejamento do PAC adia votao do Oramento
description.content:
Um impasse entre governo e oposio acabou frustrando a previso de votao do Oramento de 2011 nesta tera-feira na Comisso Mista de Oramento (CMO). Ficou marcada para a manh desta quarta-feira uma nova reunio da Comisso para tentar votar o projeto. A expectativa votar o Oramento em plenrio no Congresso Nacional tambm na quarta, ltima de trabalho do Congresso em 2010.
O problema que travou a votao foi a possibilidade de o governo remanejar livremente 30% dos recursos destinados ao Programa de Acelerao do Crescimento (PAC). Desta forma, recursos destinados a saneamento podem acabar em obras de ferrovias ou rodovias, por exemplo. A oposio no concorda e exige que o remanejamento seja feito somente dentro da mesma rea. O texto em votao prev investimentos de R$ 40,15 bilhes no PAC, podendo chegar a R$ 43,5 bilhes se for desejo do executivo.
A posio da oposio essa. No d para aceitar isso. A nossa posio vai ser a mesma agora ou depois, ento se no houver acordo nisso pode acontecer de no votar o Oramento, afirmou o deputado Rogrio Marinho (PSDB-RN), lder do partido na comisso.
O vice-lder do governo no Congresso, deputado Gilmar Machado (PT-MG), destacou que esta discusso j foi feita outras vezes na Casa, mas concordou em adiar a votao para se tentar um acordo.
Machado afirmou que outros impasses j foram superados, como cortes de verbas nos ministrios da Educao e de . Neste caso, segundo o petista, haver recomposio do Oramento.

description.hltext_display: EsportesSem Adriano, Verdo procura Everton Santos para reforar ataque
description.content:
O Palmeiras queria Adriano, mas o Imperador resolveu ficar em Roma. Era mesmo mais um sonho do que uma possibilidade concreta. Mas o clube tambm est atrs de outros candidatos a assumir a condio de parceiro de ataque de Klber. O perfil j est definido h um bom tempo por Felipo: veloz, habilidoso, capaz de fazer gols e proporcionar assistncias e que saiba jogar pelos lados.
E o mais novo pretendido para essa vaga Everton Santos. O atacante pertence ao Paris Saint Germain, da Frana, mas jogou em 2010 emprestado ao Gois. Ele ficou no grupo que caiu para a Srie B do Brasileiro e perdeu a final da Sul-Americana para o Independiente at o final da temporada, como reserva.
Everton foi revelado pelo Bragantino, na mesma equipe que teve o goleiro Felipe como destaque e foi semifinalista do Paulisto de 2007. Sua atuao no Estadual daquele ano fez o Verdo ir atrs dele, mas o jogador acabou fechando com o Corinthians. Chegou no Parque So Jorge com status de atleta de ponta, mas saiu de l sem deixar muitas saudades - foi rebaixado com o time para a Segunda Diviso do Brasileiro de 2007.
De fato, o ltimo bom momento de Everton foi justamente no Bragantino, h mais de trs anos. Depois disso, perambulou sem voltar a se firmar - foi reserva tambm no Fluminense no Brasileiro de 2008. Mas se ele no tem l um currculo que empolga, Everton corresponde s caractersticas procuradas por Felipo. veloz, sabe driblar e atua pelos dois lados do campo.
A deciso de tentar a contratao de Everton Santos uma medida de contingncia, depois que as outras opes que mais interessavam ao clube praticamente foram descartadas. O clube, porm, no est disposto a fazer um alto investimento, ou seja, quer o jogador de graa, apenas com a obrigao de lhe pagar salrios. Mas talvez esse no seja um grande empecilho, j que Everton nunca emplacou no Paris Saint Germain e vive sendo emprestado pelo clube francs sem muita cerimnia.
Os dois primeiros nomes indicados pelo tcnico e que chegaram a ser procurados pela diretoria foram Neto Berola, do Atltico-MG, e Maikon Leite, que fez uma boa temporada pelo Atltico-PR mas pertence ao Santos. Nenhuma das duas negociaes vingou. O Atltico-MG no quis liberar Neto Berola, por entender se tratar de um jogador com potencial de crescimento.
J Maikon Leite cansou de deixar explcito que prefere ficar no banco do Santos, jogando a Libertadores, do que ir para outro clube - a confuso de procuradores que dizem ser representantes de Maikon tambm fez o Palmeiras esfriar seu mpeto. O Palmeiras no descarta totalmente a possibilidade de contratar Maikon Leite, embora ele j esteja muito mais longe de ir para o Palestra Itlia do que esteve no comeo das conversas, quando o Brasileiro ainda nem tinha se encerrado.

description.hltext_display: Obama spy's chief appears ignorant of British plot
description.content:
WASHINGTON (AFP) US President Barack Obama's top aide on intelligence appeared to be completely unaware in a television interview of the arrests this week of 12 men accused of plotting an Al-Qaeda-inspired attack.
US Director of National Intelligence James Clapper was asked about the attacks, with ABC News interviewer Diane Sawyer posing the questions: "First of all, London. How serious is it? Any implication that it was coming here?" After a long pause, Clapper replied, "London?" Earlier excerpts of the interview with Obama's national security team including Clapper, chief counterterrorism adviser John Brennan and Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano had focused on the trio insisting the plots were no threat to the United States.
The 12 men were arrested Monday in a sweep in the Welsh capital Cardiff, the central English town of Stoke-on-Trent, Birmingham and in London.
Sawyer brought up Clapper's apparent ignorance of the developments later in the interview. "I was a little surprised you didn't know about London," she said. "Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't," Clapper replied. Between the interview's filming Monday and airing a day later, the office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) issued a statement, insisting the "question about this specific news development was ambiguous." "The DNI's knowledge of the threat streams in Europe is profound and multi-dimensional, and any suggestion otherwise is inaccurate," said the department.
Clapper is tasked with giving Obama daily briefings on timely intelligence assessments.
Meanwhile Tuesday the US leader and British Prime Minister David Cameron spoke by telephone and discussed the arrests in Britain of the 12 men.
The arrests of the men aged between 17 and 28 came amid heightened tensions following last week's Stockholm suicide bombing, which was conducted by a man who lived and was allegedly radicalized in Britain.

description.hltext_display: BrasilAssembleia de So Paulo aprova Oramento de 2011
description.content:
A Assembleia Legislativa de So Paulo aprovou nesta tera-feira o projeto de lei do oramento estadual que prev receitas e despesas de R$ 140,6 bilhes em 2011. O projeto passou com 59 votos favorveis e 17 contrrios. Os parlamentares vo analisar nas prximas horas o acolhimento de 2.464 emendas e a rejeio de outras 11.109.
Os deputados estaduais paulistas tambm analisam na noite desta tera-feira o projeto de lei complementar 45/2010, que altera a Lei Complementar 846, de 4 de junho de 1998, que trata das Organizaes Sociais de Sade (OSSs), gestoras de hospitais e laboratrios pblicos no Estado.
A nova lei estabelece que hospitais geridos pelas OSSs atendam no apenas pacientes do Sistema nico de Sude (SUS) e do Instituto de Assistncia Mdica ao Servidor Pblico Estadual (Iamspe), mas tambm pacientes de convnios de sade privados at o limite de 25% de seus leitos.
Para que pacientes de planos privados recebam atendimento necessrio que a unidade de sade gerida pelas OSSs seja a nica detentora de mais de 50% da oferta de servios de sade em determinada regio e que preste servios de sade especializados e de alta complexidade.
O governo argumenta que hospitais como o do Cncer, Dante Pazzanezze, e do Instituto do Corao, que realizam atendimentos de ponta, podero receber pacientes da rede privada e serem ressarcidos por seus gastos.
O projeto diz que caber Secretaria da Sade a definio das unidades que podero ofertar seus servios a pacientes particulares ou usurios de planos de sade privados.

description.hltext_display: Michael Lohan urges Lindsay to press charges
description.author: Bangshowbiz
description.content:
Michael Lohan wants daughter Lindsay to press charges against the woman who claims the actress attacked her. A worker at Betty Ford Center - where the 'Mean Girls' star is currently living in a sober house as part of her court-ordered rehabilitation programme - has alleged Lindsay lashed out at her after she and her roommates arrived home late on December 12 so she is now at the centre of a criminal battery investigation. However, Lindsay's father Michael insists the claims are false and wants the 24-year-old star to go to the police as he says the woman was the one doing the attacking.
He told website X17online: "The woman who claims she was attacked in the house had it out for Lindsay since day one. She didn't want her to drive and didn't want to give her any passes to go out. This lady tried to do everything she could to not allow Lindsay to do the things she's entitled to. "Lindsay had gone to get her hair done with two girls from Betty Ford. While Lindsay was at the salon, the two girls left for a bit. After the girls got back to pick up Lindsay, they returned to Betty Ford ten minutes late. When they walked in, instead of the Betty Ford staffer addressing all the girls, she grabbed Lindsay by the arm and told her she needed to take a urine sample immediately. Lindsay told the woman, 'Get your hands off me' and brushed her away. Lindsay never assaulted her. I want Lindsay to press charges on this woman for grabbing her first." Michael claims the woman wants to ruin Lindsay's chances of being released from the clinic on January 3, when she completes her court-ordered programme. He said: "I find it interesting that this woman didn't contact the Betty Ford administration before calling the police. This is her attempt to keep Lindsay from graduating. From a clinical and professional standpoint, this Betty Ford employee should lose her job."

description.hltext_display: SmarTrend Watching for Potential Pullback in Shares of CROCS After 1.79% Gain (CROX)
description.content:
CROCS (NASDAQ:CROX) traded in a range yesterday that spanned from a low of $18.88 to a high of $19.54. Yesterday, the shares gained 1.79%, which took the trading range above the 3-day high of $19.13 on volume of 3.1 million shares. Often times after large one-day gains, short term traders will seek to take profits and, as such, investors should be cautious.
Shares of CROCS are currently trading above their 50-day moving average (MA) of $15.86 and above their 200-day MA of $12.12. Look for the MA to provide support for a short-term pullback in the shares.
SmarTrend currently has shares of CROCS in an Uptrend and issued the Uptrend alert on September 29, 2010 at $12.99. The stock has risen 46.3% since the Uptrend alert was issued.
SmarTrend expects the share price to pullback toward the $19.13 support level. Afterwards, we expect it to move upward with its peers in the SmarTrend Textile- Apparel Footwear & Accessories industry.

description.hltext_display: Len da licencia de ocupacin a las primeras 185 viviendas de Los Juncales
description.content:
La Junta de Gobierno Local del Ayuntamiento, formada por los concejales de PSOE y UPL, aprob ayer la recepcin de las obras de urbanizacin del sector de Los Juncales, ubicado en Armunia, donde la promotora Viproelco construye 518 viviendas de protegidas de dos y tres dormitorios. Una promocin, junto con la del Portillo y la Universidad, para la cual Caja Espaa-Duero ha tenido que aplicar una inyeccin monetaria de 1,2 millones con el fin de rescatar los proyectos. Este dinero se aplica como ampliacin de capital de la sociedad inmobiliaria, dirigida por Cecilio Vallejo, en la que la entidad financiera pasa de tener el 50% a acaparar el 93%, en detrimento de Agelco. El rescate permitir que Viproelco, que en la actualidad ya ha terminado 230 viviendas, pueda continuar con la construccin de las 288 restantes en Los Jucales, as como otra 143 en el Portillo y 50 en la Universidad..
Junto con la urbanizacin, el rgano de decisin municipal tambin aprob la licencia de primera ocupacin para 115 pisos de este sector, que se encuentra en la zona de desarrollo de Armunia, prxima a la nueva estacin de Adif y el futuro Palacio de Congresos.

description.hltext_display: Baixada SantistaBertioga probe as chamadas 'pulseiras do sexo'
description.content:
Os estudantes adolescentes de Bertioga esto proibidos de usar pulseirinhas coloridas nas escolas pblicas da Cidade.
A lei, de autoria do vereador Caio Arias Matheus (DEM), foi aprovada pela Cmara e sancionada pelo prefeito Mauro Orlandini. Conforme a proposta, cabe aos diretores e ao corpo docente e aos pais ou responsveis realizar reunies para esclarecer tal vedao e orient-los em relao a situaes envolvendo questes sexuais.
Esses acessrios ficaram famosas entre os adolescentes por trazer tarefas conforme a cor de cada pulseira arrancada.
As obrigaes tinham conotao sexual. Fui procurado por mes preocupadas com esse tipo de jogo. Aqui em Bertioga, assim como em muitos locais, essas pulseirinhas estavam virando uma febre e trazendo um estmulo sexual precoce s crianas, diz o vereador.

description.hltext_display: Time-out bringt durchaus etwas
description.author: Markus Schoch
description.content:
Eine Studie der Forschungsabteilung der Pdagogischen Hochschule Thurgau bt Kritik an den Time-out-Schulen. Mitverfasser Christoph Maeder przisiert und relativiert die Einwnde. Anfang Oktober beurteilte der Leiter der Forschungsabteilung der Pdagogischen Hochschule Thurgau im Interview die Time-out-Schulen kritisch. Man gehe oft von zu einfachen Vorstellungen des Problems aus und setze darum vor allem auf Disziplinierung der schwierigen Jugendlichen, womit ihnen aber wenig geholfen sei, sagte er mit Verweis auf eine Studie, deren Schlussbericht seit wenigen Tagen vorliegt. Dies lste viele Reaktionen aus.
Die Gesellschaft ndere sich, und es sei richtig, wenn die Schule Antworten auf die neuen Probleme suche, stellt Christoph Maeder klar. Das Time-out bringt durchaus etwas, indem es den Handlungsspielraum der Schulen bei Schwierigkeiten in einer Klasse erweitert. Whrend der Auszeit knne umfassend abgeklrt werden, wie es mit den Jugendlichen weitergehen soll, bei Bedarf unter Einbezug der ganzen Familie.
Im normalen schulischen Umfeld sei das nicht im gleichen Umfang mglich, sagt Maeder. Der Lehrer wre schon rein zeitlich berfordert, zumal die Probleme der schwierigen Schler oft diffus seien.
Eltern sind froh
Zu denken gegeben haben Maeder aber vor allem die Reaktionen von betroffenen Eltern, die ihm gesagt htten, wie ratlos sie ihrem Kind gegenber gewesen seien und wie froh, dass es die Time-out-Schule gegeben habe. Zu Recht hat mir eine Frau gesagt: Bei jedem Kind, fr das ein Weg gefunden wird, hat sich das Programm gelohnt, sagt Maeder. Und er gibt zu, dass diese Betrachtung in der wissenschaftlichen Untersuchung der Angebote zu kurz gekommen ist.
In der Studie wird festgehalten, dass ein Drittel der Schler nach der Auszeit in die Stammklasse zurckkehrt. Ein weiteres Drittel wechselt die Schule, und fr das letzte Drittel wird eine andere Lsung gefunden.
Ziel des Time-outs ist es, die Jugendlichen wieder in die Regelklasse zu integrieren. Dass dies in der Mehrheit der Flle nicht gelingt, hlt Maeder nicht fr problematisch. Entscheidend ist weniger die Erfllung von Zielquoten bei der Rckfhrung in die Stammklasse, als vielmehr das Finden von funktionierenden Anschlusslsungen fr die Schler.
Beachtliches Potenzial
Maeder ist sich auch durchaus bewusst, dass es die Time-out-Angebote nicht allen recht machen knnen, egal wie sie angelegt sind. Sie stehen in diversen Spannungsfeldern, wie wir in der Untersuchung zeigen.
Dabei stellen sich Fragen wie: Sollen die Angebote vor allem die Schule entlasten oder dem Jugendlichen individuelle Untersttzung geben? Steht die Strafe im Vordergrund oder der Frderaspekt? Und welche weiteren Personen und Institutionen sind an Massnahmen zu beteiligen? Wenn diese Spannungsfelder in Planung und Betrieb von Time-out-Schulen beachtet werden, dann haben sie gemss der Untersuchung ein beachtliches Potenzial fr gute Problemlsungen, sagt Maeder. (ThurgauerZeitung)

description.hltext_display: Discover the Latest Innovations in Screen-Print and Inkjet Technology
description.author: Admin
description.content:
Tags: Conferences 2011 / PEMS 2011 / SGIA
* SGIA focuses on expanding printed electronics market at 2011 Symposium
Learn about the latest applications in printed electronics for screen print and inkjet at SGIAs 2011 Printed Electronics and Membrane Switch Symposium (San Jose, California; June 1416). The highly anticipated event will explore new production processes and market trends that are driving this technical segment of the specialty imaging industry. http://www.sgia.org/events/printed_electronics/11/
Last years Symposium was such an eye-opener, said 2010 attendee Jimmy Cheung, Engineering Designer, GradTech. Being in the membrane switch business for three years and as a first-time attendee, I found this Symposium to be very informative. I definitely look forward to next years Symposium.
This hard-hitting event offers two full days of presentations focusing on printed electronics and membrane switch innovations, and will discuss how each is being adapted into the imaging community.
Dont miss these exciting opportunities at the 2011 Symposium:
-Two days of educational sessions focused on membrane switch technology; printed medical sensors and instrumentation; LED, OLED, and surface-mount technologies; printed photovoltaic technology and more
-Unmatched networking opportunities with printed electronics professionals.
-Exhibitors showcasing the current and near-future printed electronics applications.
Plan to join SGIA at the industrys top educational event for printed electronics and membrane switch professionals. For more information about the 2011 Symposium and to sign up to be notified when registration opens, visit SGIA.org, Keyword: PEMS.
SGIA Supporting the Leaders of the Digital & Screen Printing Community
Specialty imaging comprises digital imaging, screen printing and the many other imaging technologies SGIA members use, including those theyll tap in the future. These are the imaging processes and technologies employed to create new products and to enhance existing products including point-of-purchase displays, printed electronics, membrane switches, signs, advertisements, garments, containers and vehicles. Make the most of your specialty imaging business.

description.hltext_display: Los autnomos dan a conocer menos del 20% de sus accidentes laborales
description.author: mara jess muiz
description.content:
Yolanda Ferreras, Jos Miguel Garca Bellido y Mara Jess Prez, ayer en la sede de ATA.norberto Los trabajadores autnomos apenas comunican entre un 18 y un 20% de los accidentes y enfermedades laborales que padecen, y adems tienen un mucho ms difcil acceso a las actividades de formacin e informacin en materia de riesgos y salud laboral. As lo explic ayer Jos Miguel Garca Bellido, director del Centro de Sallud y Seguridad Laboral de . Garca Bellido particip ayer en la presentacin de las guas sobre riesgos laborales presentadas por la Asociacin de Autnomos de . El director del centro reconoci que los autnomos son un colectivo con muchas peculiaridades, que qued excluido en un primer momento de la Ley de Riesgos Laborales, en 1995, y que luego se ha ido integrando en la normativa, hasta llegar al punto de inflexin que ha sido el Estatuto de los Trabajadores Autnomos. Garca Bellido seal tanto las dificultades para acceder a la formacin como el desconocimiento de la normativa en riesgos laborales como las principales trabas del colectivo de autnomos en materia de prevencin de la siniestralidad laboral. Como ejemplo, destac que a 30 de noviembre en el conjunto de la comunidad los autnomos slo han comunicado 390 accidentes de trabajo, de ellos slo tres graves y el resto leves. Es evidente que esto no se corresponde con la situacin real.
El responsable de riesgos laborales acompa a Yolanda Ferreras y Mara Jess Prez, de ATA Len, en la presentacin de las gias elaboradas por la asociacin en colaboracin con la Direccin General de Trabajo y Prevencin de Riesgos Laborales de la Junta. A travs de encuestas, han analizado las condiciones de trabajo de las trabajadoras autnomas inmigrantes, las nuevas enfermedades emergentes y la prevencin de accidentes de trfico. En el caso de las trabajadoras autnomas inmigrantes (casi 6.000 mujeres en ) se detecta que seis de cada diez no tiene ninguna formacin en materia preventiva, y que la mitad no ha recibido nunca informacin sobre los riesgos laborales a los que se enfrenta en su lugar de trabajo.
Casi 9 de cada 10 autnomas inmigrantes siente gran preocupacin sobre la conciliacin entre su trabajo y sus tareas domsticas, debido a que son ellas quienes llevan esta sobrecarga de forma diaria, explicaron las responsables de ATA; que aadiero que ocho de cada diez de estas mujeres padecen de forma habitual dolores cervicales, seis de cada diez dolores lumbares; y la mayora de ellas dolencias relacionadas con el estrs y la tensin emocional.
Este colectivo de mujeres, de entre 30 y 48 aos de edad, tienen un escaso nivel de formacin y llama la atencin que recurran a servicios de prevencin ajenos a su trabajo para solucionar sus problemas de salud laboral. Ms de la mitad de ellas no realiza reconocimientos mdicos, y del resto la mayora slo consultan cuestiones rutinarias relacionadas fundamentalmente con patologas ginecolgicas. ATA elabora tres guas sobre prevencin de riesgos y enfermedades en el colectivo

description.hltext_display: MundoMxico nega sequestro de imigrantes em assalto a trem
description.content:
O governo do Mxico desmentiu nesta tera-feira a verso de que dezenas de imigrantes centro-americanos foram sequestrados no sul do pas, durante um ataque a um trem.
"Esta verso no tem sustentao. No houve assalto e sequestro de imigrantes em Oaxaca. No h base para esta verso", destacou a Secretaria do Interior.
Segundo a chancelaria de El Salvador, cerca de 50 viajantes de diferentes nacionalidades foram sequestrados no dia 16 de dezembro em Oaxaca por um grupo armado que obstruiu com paus e pedras a via frrea para obrigar o trem a parar.

description.hltext_display: Assembly, Senate take different paths on surplus funds
description.author: sferriss@sacbee.com (Susan Ferriss
description.content:
When it comes to deciding what to do with money saved by reining in their budgets, the two houses of the California Legislature have taken different paths.
For three years, the Assembly has chosen to shift what it didn't spend last year it saved 12 percent of its budget to fire, parks and recreation agencies. This year, it committed to transferring some savings to a child-care program, although the money is just a fraction of the program's total need.
The Senate has opted instead to shift most of its savings last year it was 15 percent to prepay pension fund obligations.
Shannon Murphy, spokesman for Assembly Speaker John A. Prez, said in a statement that the speaker is proud to support critical programs, including helping "working people keep their jobs" by paying child-care costs.
The Senate's choice might seem less altruistic by comparison, but Senate leaders from both parties defend the decision as a wise one given the state's challenge to fulfill its public-worker retirement obligations.
"I have no problem with doing this as long as it's not increasing benefits," said Sen. Bob Dutton of Rancho Cucamonga, who is the Republican minority's Senate leader.
Dutton said shifting savings from the Legislature's operating budgets over to programs "sounds good for political sound bites, but maybe isn't the prudent thing to do."
He said legislators could get into a bind over deciding which cash-strapped programs merit some of the Legislature's savings.
Dutton did approve when both houses, in 2008-09, shifted money to the Department of Forestry and Fire Protection, which was struggling during an exceptionally bad year for fires.
Brad Pacheco, communications chief for CalPERS, the California Public Employees' Retirement System, said the Senate's prepayments go right into the pool for paying the $3.7 billion pension burden.
"There's not any special benefit for Senate employees," he said.
Nor is there benefit for senators, who no longer get public pensions. Legislators' salaries come out of operating costs but are controlled by an independent commission that has slashed them by 18 percent.
Compared with the budgets of major state agencies, the Legislature's annual appropriation is relatively small: $260 million for both houses during the 2009-10 fiscal year.
Gov.-elect Jerry Brown, however, has suggested that the Legislature cut more. He said he has identified 20 percent worth of spending he'll cut from the Governor's Office.
Some critics of the Legislature's spending habits suggest that each house should simply get less to begin with. But voters bear some responsibility for foiling that.
The Legislature's internal budgets are set by a formula that came with Proposition 140, which established term limits for legislators in 1990.
The measure slashed the Legislature's budgets by 38 percent that year, but it also established a formula setting a base amount every year that can rise, but not fall, because of population growth and other reasons.
The Legislature's budgets are used mostly to support staff salaries and benefits, which have come under attack as increasingly excessive for top aides.
A former Assembly speaker's chief of staff, for example, broke the $200,000 barrier in 2006 with an 18 percent pay hike, to $200,004.
Feeling the sting of criticism, leaders in both houses have said they would voluntarily cut operations and pass the money on.
In 2008-09, the Senate cut its $111 million budget by 13 percent, or nearly $15 million, through staff furloughs, salary and benefit cuts, a hiring freeze and cuts in supplies and publications.
As a result, the Senate shifted $4.8 million to state fire protection and the rest to prepay pensions.
In 2009-10, the Senate reduced spending by 15 percent, or almost $17 million, all of which went to pension prepayments, according to Nathan Barankin, spokesman for Senate President Pro Tem Darrell Steinberg.
"It reduces the burden going forward," Barankin said, explaining that the Senate's share of pension payments is now covered at least through the next fiscal year.
Shifting savings to various agencies "wasn't going to solve the problems" of a multibillion deficit, he said.
The Assembly began cutting spending in 2007, sending 5 percent of its $139 million budget mostly to fire protection and parks.
The next year it cut 10 percent from its $146 million budget, dividing nearly all its savings between fire protection and the Employment Development Department, whose outdated phone system was reeling under a crush of unemployment claims.
In 2009-10, the Assembly again divided between fire protection and the EDD most of about $18 million in savings, 12 percent of its operating costs.

description.hltext_display: Hovnanian Q4 Loss Narrows, Revenues Down
description.content:
(RTTNews) - Hovnanian Enterprises Inc. (HOV), Tuesday reported a loss for the fourth quarter that narrowed from the prior-year period, reflecting essentially lower land-related charges, though revenues declined. Quarterly loss was much more than what was estimated by analysts, though revenues exceeded expectations.
For the fourth quarter ended October 31, Hovnanian Enterprises' net loss was $132.11 million or $1.68 per share, compared to a net loss of $250.76 million or $3.21 per share in the year-ago quarter.
On average, 12 analysts polled by Thomson Reuters expected a loss of $0.66 per share for the quarter.
Consolidated pre-tax land-related charges for the quarter were $80.6 million, compared with $138.0 million in the prior-year quarter. The charges included inventory impairment loss and land option write-offs. Total costs and expenses for the quarter were $487.3 million versus $660.7 million last year.
The year-ago period results for the homebuilding and financial services company included loss on extinguishment of debt of $17.6 million and loss from unconsolidated joint ventures of $7.8 million.
Total revenues for the quarter dropped to $353.01 million from $437.39 million in the same quarter a year ago. Eleven street analysts expected revenues of $288.05 million for the quarter.
Homebuilding gross margin percentage, before interest expense included in cost of sales, increased to 16.9% for the quarter compared to 13.2% in last year's fourth quarter. Gross margin percentage, including interest, surged to 11.1% for the quarter from 6.1% a year ago.
Net contracts for the quarter, excluding unconsolidated joint ventures, decreased 13% to 1,078 homes. Deliveries, excluding unconsolidated joint ventures, were 1,204 homes for the quarter, compared with 1,444 homes in the prior year fourth quarter. Average price for deliveries during the quarter dropped 2.3% to $0.291 million from $0.298 million in the year-ago period.
During the quarter, home deliveries through unconsolidated joint ventures were 83 homes, compared with 82 homes in the fiscal year 2009 fourth quarter.
In new contracts signed during the period, average prices were down 17.5% in the Northeast, down 24.8% in the midwest, down 26.5% in the west, and dropped 6.3% in the southeast. Average prices improved 3.3% in the mid-atlantic and 3.7% in the southwest.
The contract cancellation rate, excluding unconsolidated joint ventures, for the quarter was 24%, unchanged versus the fiscal 2009 fourth quarter.
For the full year, Hovnanian's net income was $2.58 million or $0.03 per share, compared with a net loss of $716.71 million or $9.16 per share in the prior year. The after-tax net income for fiscal year 2010 included a federal income tax benefit of $291.3 million as a result of tax legislation changes.
Total revenues for fiscal year 2010 decreased to $1.37 billion from $1.59 billion in the prior year.

description.hltext_display: Croydon firefighters dance on ice
description.author: Harry Miller
description.content:
Firefighters from Croydon have been dipping their toes in the icy water of Clapham Common Pond.
Fire crews have been gearing up for the latests cold snap by training for rescues from freezing lakes and ponds.
Their training exercise was a chance for the firefighters to brush up on their water rescue skills and an opportunity to warn people about the dangers of walking on frozen ponds.
During the exercise a firefighter, who was wearing a wet suit and protective clothing, entered the frozen pond, whilst his colleagues, using specialist water rescue equipment, including inflatable boats, rescued him.
Station manager David ONeill, one of the Brigades water rescue specialists, who was at the scene, said: We wanted to show people how incredibly dangerous it is to walk on frozen ponds and lakes.
"Its virtually impossible to tell how thick the ice is and if you fall in, you wont survive for long in these conditions.
Wed urge people to stay well away from frozen water.
"If you have a dog, please keep it on a lead as the vast majority of people we get called out to are those who have fallen through the ice after theyve followed their dog.
With a new series of Dancing on Ice coming up wed also like to remind people interested in ice skating to practice their skills on professional ice rinks, not frozen ponds.
If you see someone in danger on the ice, or even in the water, call 999. Firefighters will attend and will use specialist equipment to get you out quickly and safely.

description.hltext_display: A Year in Review
description.content:
Author: Hussein Shobokshi
"Time" magazine named founder of the social networking website Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg, its" Person of the Year" for 2010, fending off fierce competition from WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange. This got me thinking about who were the Arab world's most influential figures in 2010; however there are numerous such lists and awards focusing on various fields, which inevitably means that they lost some of their credibility.
Therefore instead of writing an article about the most important and influential figures in the Arab world, I thought it would be better to focus upon the most important events that have affected the region this year as it is clear that this year has been full of unexpected events and issues.
There is the issue of the "indictments" that the Hariri tribunal in Lebanon is expected to issue soon. These are likely to include indictments against figures implicated in the assassination of former Lebanese Prime Minister Rafiq Hariri and other Lebanese politicians and media figures. This is an issue that has resulted in a tense situation and threats of violence being issued by some political parties in Lebanon. This news has been blown out of proportion thanks to the media coverage that it has received, and as they say in the world of Lebanese politics, this is "a lot of noise over nothing!"
Next, there was the issue over the "formation of the Iraqi government" which was formed, then dismantled, then re-constructed, amidst strange and confusing internal scenes. This also saw the entire world, from neighboring countries to distant ones, interfering in the internal affairs of Iraq.
There is also the scene in Sudan, where we are expecting to bid farewell to the country as we know it, amidst news of the expected separation. The forthcoming referendum is expected to have only one outcome, namely the secession of southern Sudan.
As for surprising news, there was the announcement of Qatar winning the bid to host the 2022 FIFA World Cup. This news shocked the world and has been subject to much debate, with people questioning Qatar's ability to host such a huge event, as well as the anger of the countries who lost the bid to such a young state.
Of course, there is still talk about the footballing war between Egypt and Algeria. In fact, Doha recently witnessed the heads of the Egyptian and Algerian Football Associations reconciling after these two countries proved that sport is not a question of a winner and a loser, but rather a matter of life and death!
We must also mention the issue of climate change, and the unexpected and unprecedented weather seen in many Arab countries. We have seen sudden heavy rainfall and severely cold temperatures in places in regions that have never experienced this before, as well as a tremendous and record-breaking heat wave. As a result, television weather reporters have become the "stars of the screen, with their coverage overshadowing political, sport, cultural and economic news.
Of course there is also the issue of terrorism and extremism. An alarming number of people implicated in terrorist cells and networks have been arrested, and everybody is now waiting for the leaders of these groups to be captured as well. It is these ringleaders who are the major problem, and the source of this plague.
Arab parliaments have also featured heavily in 2010. We have seen parliaments divide over issues that are absent, as well as decisions that have been passed. All the while people become more and more frustrated.
2010 is nearing its end, and we have seen a number of controversial events and issuesmany things that were expected to change did not, and we hope that in 2011 we will see signs that will enliven the public, not age them.
